Reviews.Title: “Blissful, relaxing, mountain retreat. A true rarity in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: ViajeroIndiana
Reviews.Content: Though many people come to Puerto Rico (and with good reason) to enjoy the island's beautiful beaches, to meander through the cobblestone streets of Old San Juan, and to enjoy the great shopping, food, and nightlife, they often forego the option of a relaxing mountain retreat. This is unfortunate because Puerto Rico is, above all, a mountainous island, and some of the most beautiful towns and most breathtaking scenery can be found in the island's interior and along its winding rural byways. I have been going to Puerto Rico at least two time per year for more than 15 years and have spent many unforgettable days in the mountains -- driving (often getting lost), hiking, visiting small towns, touring coffee plantations, etc. However, until this year I had never really enjoyed a Puerto Rican mountain retreat -- that is, I hadn't gone to the mountains with the expressed purpose of doing nothing but relaxing. It was with this in mind that my wife and I decided to spend two nights at Casa Grande with out two children (ages 9 and 6) a couple of months ago. What a great experience. I agree with those who have noted that this amazing place is a bit hard to find, but if you follow the advice of the hotel staff and many of the reviewers on Trip Advisor and head out with plenty of time and an adventurous spirit, the trip there will be very rewarding. Take your time and don't stress out if you get a bit lost. You'll find it. Also, if you do your homework and ask for detailed directions, you should have no problem getting there from either San Juan or Ponce . . . from Utuado it is really quite easy, and the roads are not nearly as bad as some reviewers claim. Now, if you try to come at night or during a torrential downpour, expect a rather unpleasant and difficult journey. The rooms at Casa Grande are simple, but extremely clean and quite spacious (see my pics). We stayed in room 11 and room 12 was unoccupied so we really enjoyed having a double balcony, so to speak. The balconies with hammocks and chairs are perfect places to sit and read a book, have a glass of wine, or to simply listen to the sounds of nature. The grounds are meticulously kept and are great fun for the kids to explore. Don't forget to bring a flashlight so you can find cuoquis (those cute little Puerto Rican frogs that you hear all the time but almost never see) nestled among the exuberant tropical vegetation. We also really loved the pool and spent a good amount of time sitting there and reading while our kids enjoyed a dip in the chilly water. The views from most of the rooms and all of the Hotel's common areas (especially the pool) are really quite incredible, so if you forget to bring a book, you can just stare off into the distance and breath in the fresh mountain air. I loved the fact that the rooms had no TVs. On the one hand this really cuts down on noise, but on the other it encourages guests to stay outside or to just relax -- something that most of us don't do enough these days. We thoroughly enjoyed our dining experiences: two dinners and two breakfasts. Even though the service was a bit slow, as some of the more negative reviewers are quick to point out, this is not at all unusual in the Caribbean (and I don't mean this in a derogatory way). It is actually something I have grown to appreciate quite a bit. You are in the mountains and have nothing to do but relax . . . what's the big rush!? And besides, the food was very good over all and excellent in some cases, and always well worth the wait. Dining on the terrace at night with the impossibly clear, star-filled sky was just amazing, and eating breakfast there was truly delightful. Get up early and sit down before the sun comes over the mountains -- sip your coffee and enjoy nature at its finest: a cacophony of tropical birds, tree frogs, roosters, etc. announces the coming of every new day. Casa Grande is a bit out of the way, to be sure, but its relative isolation adds so much to the place's charm. In any case, if you do want to use it as a base for your adventures, you can get almost anywhere on the island in a couple of hours, and there are many places much closer that are totally worth visiting. Just ask the hotel staff for suggestions. When I return (and I hope it is soon) I will do what I did last time -- sit around and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great retreat, dificult to get there.”
Reviews.Author: eldavid51
Reviews.Content: Great place. Very cozy, nice view, nice pool, great restaurant. Love the weather, tranquality, bird and nature sounds. Hate the travel. Should have a few signs here and there.........

Reviews.Title: “wow what a drive!”
Reviews.Author: david l
Reviews.Content: We came thru Ponce, south of that area- I dont recommend this route unless you are very adventurous! anyway after feeling our way around, various roads ending at unmarked intersections, turn offs, etc- we finally arrived after dark very close to 8pm. Exhausted and tired we were met by a very stoic receptionist who did ask if we had eaten- they did apparently keep the kitchen open later for us, 830 late? the meal was fairly good, but the staff- oh boy- what a downer! Dinner was served, drinks came after dinner service? why? dont you typically have a drink before dinner? No lemon in my vodka, but lime after I asked twice- So anyway we eat we drink had a very bad dessert- not once were we asked if everything was ok, did we need anything- Oh well, no etiquette what so ever- I wouldnt care SO much but TIP is included! Now I get it- $78 for dinner! Yikes- It get worse- Next morning we get up early, 8am to get Breakfast. Seated by 815- breakfast takes 45 minutes, two omelettes- thats it- we had 2 maybe 3 other tables, whom were AHEM Puerto Ricans, get their meals BEFORE us- Not once did our waiter asked us, do you need anything? your meal is coming- So WFT? I finally complained, we got served, ate and went to check out- At the desk at different women checked us out and asked how everything was and I said OK- then after several quiet minutes I suggested our meal took a long time- She got the owner who did apologize and gave me a bag of coffee! wow a $5 bag of coffee, my lucky day- I advise 1. bring your own food to this place 2. drive from San Juan during the day 3. expect lousy service( if u eat here) unless you are from Puerto Rico 4. take the drive thru the mountains and keep going

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, peaceful, and serene”
Reviews.Author: hhiwaterlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights last week, and we really enjoyed the hotel, mountain views and sounds of the nearby river, birds, roosters and frogs. The pool was refreshing and invigorating after a day of mountain hiking and ziplining. It was extremely clean, and the water seemed to simply be nonclorinated fresh water. Rooms are clean and basic, but you don't stay in the rooms anyway. The grounds are beautiful with orange, plantain, coconut, and papaya trees and many flowering bushes. The restaurant was decent, some food outstanding other food just okay, but the views are gorgeous and the slow service very friendly. All staff was very friendly. The owner Steve lead yoga classes in the am, which were very centering and, to me, well worth attending. By the way, nearby Batey Zipline Adventures was really fun and run by some interesting, local farmers. I recommend Casa Grande to anyone wanting to spend some time in the mountains exploring the more remote areas of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Read the description carefully to make sure this is for you...”
Reviews.Author: Lauren G
Reviews.Content: I quite liked our little cabin in the woods of Utuado. It was very serene, the accomodation was rather large and I loved our balcony equipped with patio chairs and a hammock. The owner has achieved a truly green experience with no radios or TVs in the rooms, only the sound of the forest. I have to qualify my statements, however, by saying that I did not do enough research on the location. If you are the type of traveler who is content to stay on site and enjoy what the retreat has prepared for you then this is for you. If not, I would consider shortening my stay. My husband and I would probably have been happy with a one-night stay because we couldn't get anywhere during the day. We like to explore and sightsee but Puerto Rico's mountain roads are not exactly reliable; some come to an end for construction after you've been driving on them for 20 minutes and there is no detour. One thing we did get to see that I would highly recommend if you are staying here is Cueva la Ventana. Skip Rio Camuy and see a cave that has not been commercialized yet!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation - beautiful scenery, fresh air, nature sounds to the max, peaceful vibe”
Reviews.Author: worldgirl97
Reviews.Content: The place and location is very peaceful. It's nestled in the mountains, with great views and a non-stop chorus of birds and frogs. Each room has it's own deck with chairs and a hammock to relax and enjoy. Room was pretty bare - you definitely want to spend time outside. The morning yoga class was a wonderful way to start the day. The restaurant was very good - breakfast was great - and it has great views.

Reviews.Title: “OK but Too Far out of the way for Basic Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Zeus S
Reviews.Content: The idea behind this resort, at least on paper or a computer screen, is very appealing but.... I have mixed feeling about our stay at Case Grande Mountain Retreat. The view from the main building is truly amazing. It's a lush mountain side facing you. Early in the morning as the sun rises and starts to crest the mountain, the sunlight begins to bath certain spots on the mountain side making for a great scene! That is truly a nice experience! The food in the main dining area was better than anticipated, fairly priced and portions were good. No one went to bed hungry. Especially if you order one of their rice dishes such as Chicken and rice. The dining on the patio of the main building was also relaxing and enjoyable. The wait staff was also very nice and aimed to please. The food and staff really made our stay more enjoyable. The other positive point I want to share is that at night there was a very nice breeze that create a wonderful sound in the surrounding trees and helped cool the room that made for good sleep. So why only 3 stars?? The rooms are REALLY basic, the location is WAY OUT of the way, and location didn't support tourists well. Let's start with the room. It was very basic and furniture and beds were simple low-end pieces. The lighting in the room was a simple bare bulb and a second reading light over one of the beds. The walls are rather thin and you CAN HEAR your neighboring guests quite clearly. So if you can hear them...they can hear you. We were fortunate that the visitors around us were generally quiet. But it was uncomfortable to hear them going to the bathroom. The cost to stay here was over $130 a night, that's not cheap. In my opinion, it's too much for the accommodations. There are no added amenities for that room rate either. Yoga is offered every morning and taught by the owner of the location. But at an added cost of $12 a class per person. I think it should be included in the room rate and not an added cost. There is no gym, if you chose not to take the morning class. There is an outdoor pool, that is billed as a "fresh water pool" . It's roughly 30'x15' and rather deep on one end at 8'. But it's heavily chlorinated. So not sure about the whole "fresh water" pitch. The location is a SOLID 45 minute drive AFTER you get off the main highway (26). It's a narrow, local mountain road and a good part of it is WHITE KNUCKLE driving as locals scream down the mountain and around blind corners in the middle of the road!! So if you are coming from San Juan, it's a solid 2.5 to 3 hour drive EACH WAY. The last portion of the drive had us wondering if we were lost and worrying what had we gotten ourselves into. The roads are not well maintained and hitting one of the many huge pothole could easily happen and would put a real damper on your vacation. If you are coming from Aquadilla, it's a short ride but a fair amount of stop and go lights before you get to the highway portion and THEN the 45 minute daredevil climb up the mountain road. The Casa Grande Mountain Retreat is also not isolated. It's neighbors are lower income homes nested on the sides of the mountain. So you see a fair amount of poverty on the drive up. The other real issue that I did read here but couldn't quite comprehend is that the road that takes you to Casa Grande continues just below the resort and about a 3 miles up ahead is some sort of water plant. Early each morning, large trucks would rumble by and constantly honk their horns as they drove by. It was rather noisy and disruptive. Definitely broke the calm of the night. My guess is the drive honks as he may be approaching a blind bend in the road and letting oncoming cars, pedestrians know he was there. Believe me, they don't slow down. They fly up and down these road like Rally car drivers and will ride you tail. Not fun! To take full advantage of the area, you need to hire an adventure guide. You need to plan that prior to your arrival. We looked into a few and found that they wanted $109 for a 4 hour tour that included zip-lines and repelling and some kayaking. It was a bit high for us as we had done these activities already outside of San Juan and also on a recent trip to Costa Rica. So we just wanted to hike on our own. There's a short trail that starts on the property. It's a short 20 minute loop. It's decent and enjoyable. The office person told us of another more difficult trail down the road. We couldn't find it. The trail wasn't marked as "a trail" but by a "thrown-out couch" which we missed. So outside of the pool, the morning Yoga class and the short trail, there's not a whole lot to do on the property. One of their staff leads a 3 hour hike for $25 a person but you need to book it at least a day in advance. We missed on that as we first tried to hike on our own ans when we realized that we could find the trails, the staff person was committed for the day. Understandable but a bummer. The bottom line for my family and me was as we drove away we all felt it was generally pleasant, very basic and the food was good but too far out of the way from the rest of the island's destinations. We all agreed a similar experience with better hiking and more food options are available near or by El Yunque Rainforest, much closer to San Juan and Luquillo Beaches. The Case Grande Retreat is the idea of transplanted retired New Yorker looking to have a place he can draw an income from, do something he enjoys (Yoga) and sustain a certain lifestyle without out of pocket expense. I think we'd all like to do something like that. Clearly the location gives a few locals an income and may draw tourist dollars to the area that would otherwise never get anywhere near here. So if you are looking to relax, get away from the heavily congested tourist and city destinations, don't like the ocean, like to drive twisty mountain roads like a rally car driver and want to travel the road 'less traveled'...this may be a place you'll enjoy. We will not do it again on a return trip to Puerto Rico and would tell our friends, "It's OK but not worth the drive."

Reviews.Title: “away from it all”
Reviews.Author: Travelman-Tx
Reviews.Content: Simple rooms without TV or phone but with a concert of wild animals at night, in an incredible green scenery. Feels like sleeping in a tree house. Just wonderful ! Dinner in the restaurant was fine, international menu and a small but good wine list. Perfect breakfast on the terrace and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort but not 5 bullets rating (yet)”
Reviews.Author: Aquarius74
Reviews.Content: First of all, the resort is amazing. The little houses are situated in a very calm and beautiful area, very far away from everything. I found the whole complex very romantic, especially at night when you hear all the birds, frogs etc. very clearly. The rooms are basic but spotless and everything is very well maintained. If you like to take a rest for a while this hotel is your thing. Please note that for the nearest town, Utuado, you will have to drive 30 minutes. Therefore Casa Grande is not a good base for exploring Puerto Rico. You will have to drive a long time time to get out of the mountains (I went to Ponce and St German, very nice but I had to drive a long time). The resort is difficult to find. I am good in navigation but for the first time in my life I had to ask the way. The route is explained very clearly on the site of the hotel but due to the long distances I was sometimes in doubt whether I was on the right road or not. Take the first exit to Utuado, after the Mc Donalds turn left, this is road 111. Follow this road for a long time and take road 140 (along the lake), after road 613 continue straight on, after a while you will have the turn 612. The only comment I have about the resort is that the staff of the restaurant and reception (there was a angry guest when I arrived) are laid back. Every night I had to ask for my drink twice and the waitresses are not very interested in taking your order. It irritated more guests as I heard others speaking about it. The food is good though (a good cook, he is a hard worker). I think it might be better if the owner is there at night instead during day time so he can keep an eye on them.

Reviews.Title: “Happiness, seclusion in an untouristed location”
Reviews.Author: Toulouse_Yankee
Reviews.Content: Before writing my review, I looked over some of the other comments and the one from sunsetkeysusie made me wonder if we were talking about the same place. We were there five days later and found most of her assertions to be far from the truth. The property was immaculate and beautifully designed, the landscaping exceptional with many varieties of plants identified, the pool sparkling clean (see my photos) and delicious to swim in. At the main house, the dining area, small bar, large veranda for dining or relaxing and an open patio for same were lovely with marvelous views of the mountain greenery. There are several multi-unit chalets on the property designed with admirable simplicity. Our room faced the pool, had a little porch with a hammock, was clean, comfortable and sufficiently equipped. The breakfast and dinner offerings were of good wholesome quality with meats, seafoods, vegetarian choices, fresh fruits and vegetables. I think it is not a place for people like sunsetkeysusie who need infinity pools, hot tubs, etc., but a good place for people of the more contemplative sort. There is an early morning yoga session, trails for walks in the woods, pleasant areas for reading, writing, conversing, bird-watching. The twisting mountain road one must travel to get there just adds to the aerie-like feeling of lofty seclusion. It is true that a nearby road with infrequently passing traffic detracts from that. It is also true that the walls are thin, but once you understand that voices are lowered and there was a general feeling of respect. We had a very pleasant experience, found the staff to be considerate and courteous, and the spirit of the place to be calm, the surroundings beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant 2-night Stay”
Reviews.Author: CraigCT2
Reviews.Content: Other than having to yell at our late-to-bed and early-to-rise neighbors to "BE QUIET!" on our first morning, our stay at Casa Grande was wonderful. I had read the reviews here and knew to come equipped with our travel coffee-maker, shampoo and a big bar of soap. My wife requested an extra towel which was no problem for the helpful and friendly staff. The bathroom was spotlessly clean. At night we closed up the window blinds tight so that we wouldn't be cold. My travel clock has a thermometer on it and the indoor temperature at night stayed between 70 and 75F - no need for extra blankets but no need to use the ceiling fan either. I should mention that our neighbor apologized profusely for the noise - she seemed to have forgotten that the walls are thin. We were actually offered lunch while we were there although I understand this is not the norm. I thought the food was great and enjoyed speaking with chef Michael about the challenges of running a restaurant in such a remote location. We did not get lost on the way to Casa Grande - asking for directions in Utuado helped. We did drive by the entrance to the resort however, as the gate with its name had been blown shut. Casa Grande's owner Steven was cordial and ever-present. We knew we were in good hands should something go wrong. If we ever visit Puerto Rico again, we will surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not really mountain retreat...”
Reviews.Author: treddd
Reviews.Content: Only thing 'retreat' about this is the fact that it's miles away from anything.. Not worth driving all the way out for this. The accommodation is very basic, and it's on the wrong side of the fine line between green minimalism and overpriced shack.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe this is good for some”
Reviews.Author: leisuresusie
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world. I have been to every Carribean Island. This ranks right up there with one of the worst hotels I have ever been to. It reminds me of the camp I went to as a child. The room was sparse. I sat on our porch and my view was of the steps you pray don't fall as you walk down. They and the railing are all moldy as everything there. Don't tell me it is because it is in the woods. The driveway and all concrete is cracked and unsightly. The pool was all cloudy. I own a pool it should never look like this does. I don't think a penny has been spent here in 20 years. I woke up this morning to the sound of my neighbors talking about underwear. This was funny. I am now sitting on the patio of my new hotel. We swam in two infinity pools. Got in a hot tub. Guess what it is 30.00 cheaper. To think we drove four hours to get to Casa Grande ads salt to my wounds. Get a tent it couldn't be any worse than this. Oh forgot it sits right on the highway so you hear traffic and trucks honk as they round the corner. I now going to say a prayer we are not there tonight

Reviews.Title: “Stunning mountain scenery, hidden retreat”
Reviews.Author: Alan H
Reviews.Content: The retreat takes a bit of effort to get to but it is worth it. It has very nice cabin style rooms with a deck where you can sitback and try to take in the mountains above and around you. At night the local tree frogs were singing and you felt like you were in a tropical jungle. There was a small pool which was unexpected but just great for a quick dip. The food is served family style and was very good and very reasonably priced. We spoke with Chef Mike and were suprised to learn that he had been a chef at a major hotel chain before coming here, no wonder! We walked a few of the trails and they are native so a little effort is required which was to be expected and consistant with the experience. The facility is called a retreat for a reason and if you are looking for TV's, Phones, etc then maybe you are missing the point, it's great the way it is. We had limited time or we would have liked to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “No phone, no internet, no TV, Really get away”
Reviews.Author: elizabethjoannepalme
Reviews.Content: Tranquil, tropical green setting in a hollow of the Utuado Mountains, was simple, upgraded, identical quad cabins with nice baths with warm water. The cafeteria style food was tasty,and healthy with self serve drinks. Coffee was ready at 8 am so early riser, coffee drinkers had to roll over and fall asleep again. I believe a coffee maker in the room would have been a welcome addition. We arrived at 3pm since we could not check in earlier. As we arrived the daily afternoon mountain rains began so we were cabin bound. We took a well needed rest after navigating the windy narrow pot filled roads.Rt 111 becomes very rough going after Moca. After the rains, while waiting for dinner at 6pm, we attempted the walking paths but turned around because the condition of the irregular rocky paths were muddy, slippery with downed leaves If you are looking for no distractions, surrounded by nature with no water and little or no sky views since the retreat is located in a depression (no sunset or sunrise), then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Rooms, Good Food, Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: KeithB05
Reviews.Content: If you prefer a nice get-away with good food and pretty views, this is the place. In Puerto Rico the beaches are great and San Juan is fascinating, but donâ€™t disregard the beautiful interior of the island. This is a great location to tour some of this region. We did have a problem of the power going out on our second evening and stayed out for about 18 hours. But the staff did their best in a pinch to be creative and find a way to serve food and provide lighting.

Reviews.Title: “So relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Alexpuertorico
Reviews.Content: The place is great! The resaurant is awesome! Breakfest even better! I really enjoyed my stay! I stayed in July 2011 and the weather was perfect, the place is so beutifull. I have never seen nothing like it and i'am from Bayamon, PR.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous location hard to get to but worth the trip.”
Reviews.Author: 4dakz
Reviews.Content: Casa Grande offers a tranquil setting. It is situated in the mountains of an old coffee plantation. The flowers and trees are exotic and grand. This draws beautiful humming birds. The setting is tranquil. The rooms are very basic there is no tv or radio. The cafes food is wonderful. A little hard to get to but worth the trip. Owner is present but aloof.

Reviews.Title: “Removed from the city but not the noise”
Reviews.Author: CatfriendDavis
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Casa Grande Mountain Retreat. It is a 30 minute drive on small country roads once you leave Utuado, the nearest city. The road is windy and narrow, but there really wasn't too much traffic getting there; it was manageable. From the name of the inn, I was expecting a more quiet experience, especially after having been at Ceiba Country Inn a few nights prior. The inn itself is well kept with a good, competent, friendly staff. There is an awesome yoga studio available for use if a class doesn't happen during your visit. Two or more people are needed to run a class. The pros: the place is lovely in a beautiful removed mountain setting with comfortable cabins. You can sit out on the balcony or hang in a hammock, you can sit in the common eating area, or lounge by the pool. In the afternoon the clouds come over the mountain and you can watch and listen to the rain fall. The cons: being that it's on a mountain side, you can hear all manner of noise from any nearby housing, and also from the few cars going up and down the road. Wednesday night is evangelical night, so we were subjected to loud speaker preaching and hallelulia singing for quite a while as the car with the mounted speakers made its way up the mountain. This was not very retreat-like. The sounds of nature were few and far between; no symphony of coquis here. We were fortunate to not have neighbors in our cabin, but it was obvious that sound carries easily from one guest accommodation to another. The trek from the car is up some steep steps which is hard for less mobile guests. The worst part is the remoteness of the place in terms of not having food choices. The restaurant there was great, and the chef really good, and I'm glad because there was no where else to eat! They only served breakfast and dinner, so you really needed to have your own food for lunch. I found this inconvenient if you didn't want to make the trek all the way to Utuado. I think we were hard up because it was holiday week and places were closed. No meals were included in the price. I didn't find Casa Grande idyllic enough for the inconvenience of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: KatieTravels89
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here as part of a trip around Puerto Rico. It was very well maintained, clean, rustic, and charming. At night the bugs in the room were a bit overwhelming. The food was great, but slightly over priced. Rose was wonderful at the front desk. The server we had throughout the trip wasn't very friendly. I would have expected a quaint place like this to be more friendly and warm.

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing Retreat, but just Average”
Reviews.Author: Wendy C
Reviews.Content: After an adventurous drive to Casa Grande, we decided we weren't leaving until Checkout. It was a great retreat and time to be unplugged. However, 1 night would have been more than enough for us. We did the short hike, however, after being in El Yunque for two nights, it just didn't compare. Beautiful scenery, but as others said - the walls inside the rooms are paper thin.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: Roberto M
Reviews.Content: Paradise Found Writer, traveler, back road aficionado and nature worshiper that I am, it takes a great deal to impress me in the way of an overnight escape. Ditto for my Puerto Rican-born wife whose taste for the exotic, unexpected and unspoiled is second to none. Finding Shangri-La in Puerto Rico takes a little luck, time, and skilled driving (on some of the worldâ€™s narrowest but most breathtakingly beautiful view-revealing roads). And then you have to possess the ability to somehow tear yourself away at the end of your stay from this, the Casa Grande Mountain Retreatâ€” a discovery which has to rank as one of the worldâ€™s truly unknown vacation treasures. Private, rustic, exotic and comfortable, this former coffee plantation a short drive outside the mountain town of Utuado is comprised of a restored main house nestled amongst gorgeous gardens, native trees and a handful of simple yet pristine and welcoming cottages. Complete with gourmet chef, gracious staff, erudite owner, and the sounds of birds by day and the coqui frogs and rushing river by night, this to me is Paradise Found. Donâ€™t come if you came to Puerto Rico searching for a getaway thatâ€™s mere minutes from San Juan and conveniently accessed by roads with a passing lane. Those seeking a locale rich in clubs and bright lights and the sounds of manâ€”not the distant rush of a jungle river lulling them to sleepâ€”should seek their brand of getaway perfection elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Piece of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Luba L
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Casa Grande Mountain Retreat as part of a yoga and meditation retreat held in November of 2011. It was one of the most remarkably peaceful and delightful experiences I have ever had. Being cradled in the valley of a mountain rain forest was beyond compare. Waking up every morning to a view of the clouds rolling over the mountains like a magnificent waterfall was one of the most sublime experiences I have ever had, and I have traveled the world. The gorgeously landscaped grounds are stunning and, at the time we were there, the orange trees around the property were dripping with fruit. The salt water pool is such a wonderful change from over-chlorinated pools at other resorts which I have visited and it was a refreshing treat in the hot afternoons. Chef Mike created truly delicious meals that were saturated with flavour, made with the freshest of ingredients, and are very healthy to boot. It was a wonderful culinary experience that enhanced the surroundings even more. The accommodations are simple and basic, so if you are used to high-end, five star spots and are not comfortable with anything less, this is not the place for you. But if you are fine with a plain, clean and comfortable room with ample hot water, this resort is worth it for the setting alone. I would go back in a heartbeat and i do hope to come back for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great rustic location and great chef”
Reviews.Author: CYLau
Reviews.Content: Casa grande is a wonderfully peaceful retreat. Mike is a fantastic chef. He's creative with his menu, but will modify according to your preferences. The rooms have nice little balconies, but they are a bit dark inside. Be sure to drive to Casa Grande while there is still daylight.

Reviews.Title: “Mt. Retreat with some real limits”
Reviews.Author: Momohat
Reviews.Content: Pros: Comfy hammock, clean, really good food and lively conversation with Chef Michael, beautiful mountains surrounding, pleasing landscaping, nice pool, met really interesting folks we dined with. Cons: We arrived at night after a harrowing drive through largely unmarked roads to be taken to our room POOL SIDE! I remember selecting what looked like a room nestled high in the mts with a view of mts. Pros: I said I couldn't stay there and was given a room vacated by a someone who had canceled. More Cons: A yoga retreat was in session the days we were there so there was no yoga (as advertised) offered to us non-retreatants; the group dominated the eating area with 10-12 at a long table and one or two tables of 2 nearby. We chose to schedule meals after they had left due to noise level. The privacy and solitude that is advertised is severely tempered by the proximity of neighbors. Thin walls allowed us to hear clear snoring, coughing, velcro opening, and other things we really didn't want to know about. The second day a black suv had parked in the night right in our line of vision (of pristine nature) and right on a path with little wrought iron tables and chairs on either side. It was there when we left around noon amidst the incredible roar of lawn tools that went on for more than an hour. A relief to leave. Not as sweet and restful as some have portrayed. We love to camp and stay in primitive/simple places. ie we don't need luxury, just rest and attention to fulfilling the advertised situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: Naomi M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I run two companies and we are also parents of three girls, we really needed to get away from our hectic routine. We had a great time, we went hicking, to the pool and all the wonderful surroundings. The staff is very nice, the rooms are clean. We didn't want to leave. We will be back soon to unwind and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get away!”
Reviews.Author: Eddie J
Reviews.Content: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nEf-p-jPjWI This was a great place just to get away. The view was outstanding and pool was refreshing. Also everyone was very nice. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Lackluster Vegetarian Food”
Reviews.Author: KDG1andKDG2
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent, central location for getting out and about to the surrounding areas. Unfortunately, part of the decision to stay here was based on teh vegetarian cuisine - which was very lackluster. Depending on where you are from, you may call this secluded, but our room was located directly over a paved road that had occasional loud traffic (especially at dawn). Overall, very friendly and helpful staff, very clean, and very comfortable (except road noise).

Reviews.Title: “glad to have visited”
Reviews.Author: hotredhatqueen49
Reviews.Content: Loved the old fashioned cabins with hammocks. Loved the view, the food, the big house with large outdoor patio. Loved the foliage and the sound of the river down the hill. Loved that yoga is right on premises. Lovely little pool area. Great place for reflection and relaxation. A definate return.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful place”
Reviews.Author: k k
Reviews.Content: Quiet and peaceful place nearly in the rain forest. Nice and simple rooms, with a beautiful setting in a gardened landscape. A little swimming pool is overlooked by the restaurant. We liked the food of the restaurant, if you go there, we suggest to give the French Toast at breakfast a chance, this is really something special! Due to the Coqui frogs and birds around, it can be a particularly noisy spot during the night - but this is, what you probably came here for. There is a road passing by closely, but it is less-traveled. A relaxing spot just to sit there and watch the clouds scraping on the mountains across the valley, see the lizards catching their food, listening to the forest noises, or simply doing nothing in particular.

Reviews.Title: “A great to stay far away from civilization”
Reviews.Author: Joselinramos2
Reviews.Content: I never experienced a more relaxing and tranquil place. The pool was magical, this small hotel was beautiful, the only noise was the sound of a nearby river and some birds. The food of the restaurant of the hotel was ok, the rooms was clean, their employees were great and the whole environment was spectacular. The hotel had hot water but no tv, no ac and no signal in my cell phone. This was a real experience of a truly disconnection from the real world. The view of the mountains was great and the trails nearby was nice. We did some trail adventures, we went to a lake called Caonillas, the Camuy Caves and the Arecibo radio telescope. My wife and I enjoy it, my kids didn't like the no tv environment (I love it). This small hotel is far from the highway is not close to the near town; this is a great place to get disconnected from the world.

Reviews.Title: “As Good as a Massage”
Reviews.Author: markorcarol
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the most relaxing spots on the planet. We stayed here for two nights in mid-September and, despite the fact that I had to work part of the time, it was impossible to be stressed. There's a charming pool, the rooms have lovely mountain and river views, and Stephen and staff are helpful and friendly. The food was also spectacular and we had a great time chatting with the talented chef following our two well-prepared and tasty dinners.This is THE place to enjoy the mountains of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Nestled nicely in the mountains”
Reviews.Author: ckierstead
Reviews.Content: Relaxing pool, mostly quiet, vegetarian food options were nice. Beautiful but a bit hard to get to (though worth it for sure).

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Harold W
Reviews.Content: i have just retirned to reality after my 6th stay at this clearing in the forest. Steve and his team really do it right providing a careful balance between nature and service. I f you love lush tropical vegetation , exotic plants , peace and quiet coupled with discreet simple service you will love this green valley. Casa Grande was green before it became fashionable and they continue to do it better than anywhere else in Puerto Rico .

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: DreamOcean
Reviews.Content: My husband, brother & I spent two nights at Casa Grande at the end of a short trip to Puerto Rico (after San Juan & Rincon on the West Coast) and it was absolutely the highlight! We actually stayed there in March 2008 and came recommended to us by friends of ours (a couple living in the US Virgin Islands). I am only now posting a review as we are considering going back to PR next year and looking back with fond memories. The mountainous atmosphere is stunning, revitalizing and you feel spoiled with a pool, massage and yoga on site. My husband had a fantastic massage one morning and I started mornings out perfectly with a yoga session in the freshest of air! We did some hiking/walking around the property but really just mellowed out and took in all of the beauty. Food was fresh, delicious and varied- my husband and I are strict vegetarians (no meat and no fish/seafood) but were well catered to while my brother loved his meat options. The Western Cordillera region is not very touristy and it's a bit of adventure getting up there, but all part of the glorious experience with killer views. Your eyes will sparkle with all of the lush vegetation and lovely gardens with flowers exploding in all colors. We should have stayed longer but alas we learned our lesson for the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, and calm”
Reviews.Author: tandrys
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place with a lot to do, this isn't it. I spent several nights here reading, writing, swimming in the pool, going on walks, and doing yoga in the morning. It's removed from just about everywhere, and the road to it is windy and narrow - you aren't going to hop into town for a drink or another restaurant. The rooms are clean, there is plenty of space, plenty of storage, and the bathroom is nice. Each unit has a porch with plastic chairs and a hammock. The main building has a porch that is open all the time - during meals it's an extension of the dining room. I often just sat there to read to be a little more social, and since it is a communal area, it is possible to meet the people who are staying there - they come from all over the place! The food was excellent - very healthy and generally local. There was a yoga training taking place when I was there, so all food was vegetarian; however, the chef gave the option of fish or poultry to order. The downside is that all food and drinks are extra, and they aren't cheap. A glass of wine was about $7. Just plan on spending a good amount on food, since you won't want to leave the place in search of another option. Also keep in mind that taxes in PR are high - what seems like a decent initial price becomes pretty high with the additional food cost and all the PR fees.

Reviews.Title: “A nice retreat in the mountains of PR”
Reviews.Author: Raroach
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night here and enjoyed it vey much. Getting there is the first part of the adventure, but we are experienced driving all over the island and know what to expect. Their directions are good but we had the GPS dialed in ton a spot nearby. They wisely recommend to follow the directions and not the GPS, which is good only as a secondary guide. It would take you down some roads that you would not want to travel. The rooms are simple and spare; no AC, TV or WiFi. No refrigerator, no microwave, no shampoo and a bar of soap the size of a chiclette. Your cell phone may not have service either. Bring books, drinks and snacks. You come here to get away and relax. Lay in the hammock or sit on the porch and listen to the coquis. Watch the little lizards on the railings. Take a dip in the small pool. The food is good but not excellent and the prices fairly reasonable but not cheap. Lunch for six cost Us $175. 15% service is added on everything. The service was good and the staff friendly. Staff comes in at 8 am and puts the complimentary cafe con leche on. Before that there is nothing. The grounds are nicely kept and many of the trees and plants are labeled with common and Latin names.

Reviews.Title: “It is everything the reviews rave about and more..”
Reviews.Author: fmkyfc
Reviews.Content: After a week at the St Regis Bahia beach basking in luxury and all the creature comforts we decided to go see what the real Puerto Rico is about. So we headed out to the mountains and picked Casa because of all the lovely reviews from Trip Advisor. I can tell you that we are not disappointed. It is everything the reviews rave about and much more. The place is lovely to wind down and relax with no TV no Ac no phones. We stayed for 3 nights and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there, We love the back to basics feel of the place and sleeping with open windows and relaxing to the call of the forest. Highly recommended for those who seek something more relaxing. I highly recommend to follow the route given by the hotel website as I believe you might end up driving a longer way as there are many ways to get there and you do not want to drive too long on those narrow twist and turns road. Do stop by Utuado town for a quick lunch if you have some time. At the retreat you must try the Yoga for the ultimate in relaxation. Also take a drive down the Dos Bocas Lake. I am told there are boat rides around the lake. Unfortunately we were there on days when the boats was not operating, While at the lake do drop by the Rancho Marina for lunch. It has great food and a very nice view and atmosphere. Highly recommended. Indeed a highlight of our Puerto Rico trip and not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hide-away”
Reviews.Author: Redbecca_46
Reviews.Content: Follow the perfectly detailed directions to this surprisingly remote and lovely retreat. Steven was a perfect gentleman and host, working with me to accommodate our group of 22 new grads. Though this isn't the typical spot, you'd think, for a group of active 18-year-olds, they explored to their hearts' content, swam in the lovely pool (which Steven allowed open later than usual for the sake of our group) and filled their bellies with delicious Puerto Rican fare. The sounds of the rain forest prevented other guests from being disturbed by our group as they played games on the terrace late into the evening. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. It felt like summer camp for grown-ups!

Reviews.Title: “The best way to get back to nature”
Reviews.Author: Fire_fly0414
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as part of a week long trip to PR. We wanted a couple of nights in the mountains and that's exactly what we got. If you enjoy nature, and don't mind the noise of the croqui or no a/c (which I consider like camping) then this is the place for you! The food isn't too bad and the restaurant is moderately priced. If you want options the town of Utuado isn't far but remember that you're driving in the mountains so everything takes time, but hey, you're on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: jeriannw
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed for 3 days in the middle of April. Very nice. Wonderful food, and our evenings were spent having drinks on the patio with other guests. We went on the hike of the trail that was on the property one of the mornings. We also visited the Caguana Indigenous Ceremonial Park in Utuado. The staff was very professional and we had wonderful meals each day (breakfast & dinner). Very relaxing to lie in the hammock and enjoy the quiet. We didn't swim at all but there is a quite nice pool there and also yoga. There is WIFi available at the main building, which my husband had to use to keep in contact with his job. No phones or TV in bungalows. Just perfect. We sat & read our books when we were at the bungalow & watched the clouds coming over the mountains & visited with the resident kitty.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location”
Reviews.Author: IslandgirlB
Reviews.Content: Wow...the setting is just beautiful! I was only there one night, but wished for more (just like i was told when i booked-"you may want to consider more than one night"). The central mountains are just beautiful. Yes, the roads are a little windy, but the payoff is huge. the rooms (#12) was large and comfortable. The shower was the strongest we had in all of Puerto Rico! Wi-Fi only in the lounge...but was s-l-o-w...so not really worth it. The location was peaceful and relaxing. My only complaint is that breakfast should be included, especially at the prices they charge. There is nowhere else to go to eat, so you are kind of captive! The food was good, but pricey. I wouldn't mind paying for dinner if breakfast had been included!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, secluded, great food, relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: sj-jj-houston
Reviews.Content: Although a bit challenging to get to, the drive is just the beginning of the experience. Once you arrive, you will love it here. Swing in the hammock, swim in the freshwater pool, enjoy the mountain jungle. The restaurant was fabulous, and well staffed with experienced help. The food was plentiful and delicious. Relax, take a hike on the mountainside nature trail, read a book, and take it all in. Enjoy the seclusion, no phones, and no tv's. Connect with the one you love in a new way. We will be back someday for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every respect”
Reviews.Author: haddockgreg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and would have loved to stay for at least a week. The rooms are simple but lovely, and you go to sleep at night with the sound of a million coquis singing - unique to Puerto Rico! The location is very beautiful, there is a lot to see in the area (you need a car!), the staff are very friendly, welcoming and helpful, and the food at both breakfast and dinner is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A great get-away location in the Toro Negro Rain Forrest area of PR”
Reviews.Author: viprofessionals
Reviews.Content: A very secluded location nestled in the Toro Negro Rain Forrest area of PR, every cottage has great views & most have a hammock to relax & take it all in ... The lady chef cooks up very creative offerings, u must take them in at least once ... Don't pass her up! Great location to explore the area from ... two lakes, Lago Caonillas & Lago Dos Bocas are only minutes away, as well as many rivers (rio Yunes) and others. Much to see and explore if u r into eco-tourism. Don't forget your camera, you'll get many memorable shots.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant food and service needs big improvement”
Reviews.Author: gresatre
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the lovely mountain area in March 2011 but not in this hotel. As there are no restaurants through out the week in a radius of 15 miles we decided to give the Casa Grande Restaurant a go. What a disappointment . We arrived and sat on a table on the outside patio. The napkins and cutlery where cafeteria like and the table not properly laid up. The waitress on duty was under pressure and the receptionist (she was nice and helpful) had to help out. I ordered Steak and my wife the Chicken .The main course was served with rice and carrots with no alternative offered . My wife's Chicken was fine but she did not like rice but my Steak was like leather, luckily I still have my own teeth :-) We did not complain as we don't like to upset staff and we where on vacation . I asked the couple dining on the other table how his Steak was and he agreed with me that it was like leather too. Looking at the hotel I can say it needs a woman tough. Table clothes on the table, proper napkins, flowers and descent cutlery would not go a miss. A choice of vegetables and a more professional approach is recommended. Let's hope the proprietor reads this so I can see some changes at my next visit. I must compliment the setting and surrounding of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Retreat, indeed!”
Reviews.Author: robbgrimm
Reviews.Content: A couple of nights at Casa Grande Mountain Retreat was a real retreat. Hospitality is high on the list accolades. In our opinion, the meals were superb! ---very flavorful and wonderfully prepared. And what a treat to be seated on the deck overlooking a most magnificent view! The premises are well maintained with attention to detail. Casa Grande is beautifully isolated in the mountains; which also means that it is a chore to get to most anywhere! We were prepared to enjoy a morning of Zip-lining, etc. with Batey Zipline Adventure (well worth it, but we'll review elsewhere). This required about an hour's journey, so plan ahead. Also, we missed an opportunity to dine for lunch on the lake which we understand to be another great experience. On one of our weekend evenings, we were headed into town to pick up supplies only to be surprised to discover, in the midst of darkness, in the middle of the rural road, about what must have been 150-200 riders on horses. To the best of our understanding they were "bar-hopping!" "But of course! we're out in the country, what does one expect!!!" A real cultural experience. There is only one negative reflection we offer: the "pods" which form the accommodations are constructed with extremely thin walls. Vocal pod neighbors can be a distraction to the tranquility one might expect at a "mountain retreat." Otherwise Casa Grande is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing under pressure”
Reviews.Author: chump2010
Reviews.Content: The rooms and ambiance are as promised, simple and clean, but the service at the restaurant was awful. Chef was MIA and staff was running around with no idea what to do. They couldn't even tell us what was available or prices. We ended up getting a mediocre meal, waiting a very long time, and being overcharged. After a couple hour experience, it was obvious no one was going to ask us how our meal was or help us out, so we signed our bill and left. The next day we checked out and no one asked us about our visit, when I would have been glad to offer this feedback in person. We liked the location, but there's not good access to other food options nearby so I'd suggest against staying here. We received better food for less than half the price at other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil? Relaxing? Traveler beware...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Casa Grande gets mixed reviews. The setting and charm of this mountain "retreat" have been well described by other reviewers. Our mostly good experience was overtaken by the talking, storytelling, and laughter of a group staying below us- continuing up until midnight. Not a big deal unless you are in a VERY otherwise quiet setting intended to be tranquil and relaxing - where sound travels. It appeared to be a group of businessmen there for a meeting. It should have been very apparent to the management that this was a disturbance to the other guests, but I don't know if they were even around on the property- if they were I would imagine there would be some kind of vested interest in maintaining the peace after hours. Without attention to that, the tranquility, relaxation, and a good night's sleep are a gamble. The value lost. Too bad. It's got a lot of other things going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting, friendly staff, disappointing food.”
Reviews.Author: TropicalLady65
Reviews.Content: This idyllic mountain location offers overwhelming vistas. The drive up is amazing in many ways. We enjoyed the yoga, massages and the friendly staff. The pool is beautiful and the identification of many of the plantings in the fabulous gardens is a real plus. It has all the makings of a truly fabulous retreat. Unfortunately there are numerous opportunities for improvement. Comfortable beds with fitted sheets that stayed in place would be a start...maybe they are a tad too small for the mattress? Thin walls allow you to hear all those sharing the divided space whether they are snoring or speaking softly. For me, personally, I found the food the most disappointing aspect. While the breakfast offerings were tasty, the orange juice fresh and real maple syrup was provided, the dinners were very disappointing. The menu offered vegetarian and vegan choices but I found them to be boring and tasteless. I believe the mixed vegetables served with every entree were frozen and that the rice was prepared from packaged mixes. Neither consistent with what one would expect of a place concerned with body and mind of guests. Don't understand why one would cut corners in this department...it isn't expensive or time consuming to prepare fresh, tasteful meals...it just takes someone who knows how to do it. Too bad, it could make all the difference. I won't recommend this to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our trip”
Reviews.Author: TucsonKatie
Reviews.Content: The setting here is gorgeous and relaxing and the staff is great. Loved having a morning yoga class. The rooms are basic but clean and the hammock on the porch is great as is the swimming pool. The walls are thin so you will hear your neighbors conversations above the chorus of birds but it is worth it! The road in is winding and there is not a lot to do but relax but it was still the highlight of our week in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Special mountain forest place, beautiful location.”
Reviews.Author: carpentertourist
Reviews.Content: Casa Grande is really special. Great "retreat" as advertised, and we found there to be many friendly guests to talk to, hang out and trade Puerto Rico tips with. We always try to not use AC and there is none in the basic but airy rooms which have lots of louvered ventilating windows and a powerful ceiling fan (which we didn't need). Of course this means that all the jungle noises (coqui frogs) come in and sometimes guest noises and crowing roosters from across the road etc. If you are a light sleeper, bring ear plugs to the PR countryside. The food is really good. They have an excellent chef, and the afternoon and evening waiters/bartenders, Evie and Jose, are terrific. We enjoyed their company and they treated us very well. Steve, the owner, is a friendly and benevolent presence and according to my wife who attended, an excellent yoga teacher. You are really up in the wild mountains at Casa Grande, and the roads are windy and exciting. However, we found that as far out as it is, in fact it was only 45 minutes to a really good North Coast beach and romantic and delicious restaurant (Saltire) on the beach near Arricibo. From Casa Grande we day-hiked a State Park in the Jungle (Guajataca) with a large cave (bring a flashlight), visited the Arrecibo Observatory, walked Casa's own trail and did a lot of reading in the hammock on our private deck. The pool is very nice, also. I highly recommend this spot for anyone who would rather not be in a slick resort, but actually in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Retreat to the mountains, find tranquillity, pristine wildlife, excellent cuisine, facilities & hospitality”
Reviews.Author: supertrooper01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to spend the last 3 days of our Puerto Rican tour at this hotel. We found exactly what we were looking for in terms of: 1) Location - set in a high, forested valley with a river flowing past the bottom of the botanical gardens in the grounds. My special interest is wildlife photography and I found plenty of opportunities to get some good shots not only in the surrounding area but also in the grounds of the hotel. 2) Facilities - Chalet-style structures on concrete stilts set into the canopy of the surrounding forest with good walkways to the central restaurant and the swimming pool. The rooms are comfortable and well equipped, great bathroom, anti-mosquito nets on all windows, and a ceiling fan (no A/C). 3) Cuisine - a great restaurant with a good wine cellar 4) Service - friendly and responsive, yoga and massage available. If you're looking for an up-market, comfortable hotel away from the coast and are interested in birds and wildlife, then this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Lush, peaceful, low-key...”
Reviews.Author: GandK0504
Reviews.Content: Casa Grande is the definition of lush. It's set high up in the mountains of Utuado. Very peaceful and serene, and it's perfect if you really want to get away from it all. Once you complete the journey, which culminates with a 45 minute drive up very narrow and winding roads, you won't fee like leaving until check-out. If you're looking to escape and relax, then this is the place for you. On the upside, the grounds are gorgeous. The cabins are set apart from each other and surrounded by lush, tropical vegetation, beautifully landscaped. The rooms are very basic. There's a restaurant with an eclectic menu that we found to be hit-and-miss, especially since we ate there three times per day. Were a little bummed when the Sunday lunch menu was the same as the Saturday dinner menu. Would have enjoyed more traditional Puerto Rican food, and wondered if hiring a local cook might be a more interesting choice. The pool is nice, and had there been more sunshine, I could have happily lounged by it all day with my book. We visited in early January and wondered if it is always as cold and rainy up in the mountains of Utuado, or was it just the two days we were there. We ended up taking a hike around the property in the rain, and then reading and napping. The owner was present and was very friendly and accommodating. Some of the staff seemed a little shy, and after asking three different people about getting a load of laundry done, which I said I was happy to pay for, I finally gave up. This was kind of a bummer, because after two days of rain our clothes were wet and muddy. All in all, we had a nice time, and would recommend it for most travelers. The air is clean and fresh and the place is quiet and low-key. And it was nice to see a less touristy part of Puerto Rico. A helpful tip: your GPS will cease to work properly once you get to Utuado, so you will need detailed directions. My Google maps app on my iPhone came in handy when combined with the written directions in the Frommer's guide.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I imagined and more......Tom & Linda, Winnipeg, Canada”
Reviews.Author: LNandTH
Reviews.Content: From our first call to Casa Grande to our departure, Steve was the most gracious host. We were on a very loose schedule on our trip through Puerto Rico, but knew we wanted to stay at Casa Grande. We were happy that they had room for us when we called. Our room (number 21) was very cozy, great mattress, good pillows and the shower was one of the best of our trip. Beautiful yoga studio......great place to practice. Spent an afternoon by the pool (spring water) which was wonderful in this tranquil setting. We had two delicious dinners at the restaurant but have to say that breakfasts (would recommend the yogurt & granola or coconut porridge) were fantastic. Casa Grande is great value and hope to stay at this hidden gem again. Thanks Steve for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Such potential but such a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: walterbristol
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that the staff, including the owner, were very pleasant. As well, the location was magnificent. Unfortunately, the good qualities end there. My boyfriend and I went to Casa Grande with visions of a quiet retreat from the busy beaches, with plenty of nature and relaxation to be enjoyed. Once we arrived, the pleasant front desk staff directed us to a dark, bare, frigid room. We spent the first night huddled together for warmth under abrasive sheets and a flimsy blanket. The wonderful hum of the coqui was frequently drowned out with the popping springs on our horribly uncomfortable mattress and the noises of snoring through the flimsy walls that separated us from the room adjacent to ours. The next morning was no better- frigid showers, overpriced breakfasts, and approximately 4 hours of jack hammering at the freshwater pool. When asked where we could explore off the resort, the resort owner's only advice was to pay an additional sum to get a guided tour of the area. Sadly, while the resort has the makings of greatness (the staff, the pool, the mountains, the well labeled flora and nature trail), it falls far short of expectations. With some simple upgrades (eg sheets, mattresses), better planning (eg separating the few guests instead of clumping them in the same cabin, closing during renovation), and some attempt at integration and celebration of local restaurants and culture, this place could be a gem... but as it is, stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “I still daydream about this scenery and overall experience”
Reviews.Author: gurruchaga
Reviews.Content: Because my mother and I arrived to San Juan at dusk (because we missed our early flight), the drive from the city to the inn was a bit more complicated than we had planned. Because of this, I was nervous about getting to la Casa because the owner did let me know in advance that we should arrive before a certain time. However, he was extremely helpful in getting us there that night and we kept in touch every 20 minutes so that he knew if we were on the right track. Because it was dark I made a few errors in driving, but the owner was patient and got us there safely. I really appreciated this. The next day, we woke up to the sounds of the coquis, some roosters and the sound of some cars traveling past the inn. The sound of cars did not bother me much, maybe because I was too busy gazing out the window in awe of my surroundings. Since we did not see much of the landscape the night before, this view was an amazing thing to wake up to. It had finished raining and the sun was shining. We decided to check out the menu in the cafe. I ordered the vegan breakfast with "eggs" and potato, which was delicious. My mom ordered the yogurt parfait, and we shared the fresh fruit platter, which was mouthwatering. We then drove south for the day in search of the beach at Guanica. The trip was a little longer than expected, but definitely worth it. However, if I were to go back to la Casa, I would plan to stay at the inn without leaving for a few days as this is a perfect place for solid, healthy relaxation. Upon returning to the inn that night, we spent some time at the cafe having a drink and reading. Our sleep experience was very comfortable. We did need to use repellant and did wake up with some bites, but this is to be expected in a more rustic inn. Our room was very clean and simple (just what we wanted) with a ceiling fan. The food was great. The pool was perfect - clean and refreshing. On our last morning there we did not want to leave, but had already made arrangements to stay back in San Juan. I would love for my husband and 3 yr old to experience this place. It was exactly what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Oiseaux
Reviews.Content: Wow! That's the best way to describe our stay. My husband and I stayed here for two nights on our honeymoon across PR. This was definitely a highlight. I gave it a 5 based on MY experience. The hotel would be considered a 3 to real US standards set by the hospitality industry, not hotel website standards The drive there is nowhere near as bad as I've read here. Yes they are windy but I've seen worse in PR. It's a beautiful drive, enjoy the sites along the way. Tip though, if you put in the address you can find it, but you need to leave out the KM marker. You take the 10, then to the 111 to 111R and 111 again. If you stay on the one 111 it turns into some rural streets, so go with the R. Then it's the 140 I believe and the 162, which you can't miss. Best bet is follow the directions from the hotel but keep a map handy. We arrived slightly before check in and were given a room early. We were in room #3. The view was ok, you could see the mountains from the hammock. The views throughout the property are absolutely beautiful. Our room was very nice. No ac, no tv, no clock - perfect! It is very humid in this area. Luckily we packed all our clothes in plastic ziplock bags so we always had a fresh outfit to wear. At night it is cool so there is no need for AC. My husband is always warm and even he was fine. The fan is right above the bed. There are screens on the windows too, so no creepy crawlers. I miss falling asleep to the sound of the coqui. As for 'thin walls'... not really. I think what people hear is just the noise from outside. Windows are open all the time in all rooms so you hear the other rooms. I was sort of able to hear house cleaners cleaning the bathroom backing onto ours but noticed most of the sound was amplified by the window. The food here... I can't even write something good enough! Absolutely everything was beyond expectations. The only thing I would have not ordered was the greek salad. It was fine, but it wasn't a greek salad and when you taste the other food, its nothing special in comparison. It's very reasonably priced too. There is WiFi at the restaurant, and a book share by the cute bar. I can't describe how much we loved this place. My husband who is very modern wouldn't stop saying how great of a choice it was (all our stops were a surprise to him). I thought he may not like it because he loves his ac/tv more than anyone. Unfortunately I did not get a chance to try the yoga. I had plans to the morning we left but then by the time I realized it, it was too late to book. We did the El Camino hike on site. You don't see much but its a nice little jaunt. Takes max 40mins. If you are looking for a posh mountain retreat you won't find it here. This place is all about real and natural, but thats what makes it so fantastic. We both agreed this place is a MUST in PR. We will recommend it to all our friends and family. We will also make a point to return to PR just for this hotel we enjoyed our stay so much. There is nothing more sublime.

Reviews.Title: “casa grande is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: stumpycat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have come to Casa Grande for about twenty years. Every year after Christmas, we start thinking of the warmth of Puerto Rico and the beauty of Casa Grande. After we arrive, we love to sit on the deck of our room in the evening. The cool breeze chases away the heat of the day and the fog creeps onto the mountains surrounding us. In the morning and evening we enjoy our meals on ther restaurant terrace. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. After the meal we like to play checkers or chess in the lounge. We love the dog and the cats on the beautiful grounds.Sometimes we wonder why the rooster in the distance has to get up so early and crowso loudly. In general Casa Grnade is a wonderful place to relax, read, or just be on vacation. We are looking forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: pghactivetravel
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful way to spend 2 nights & 3 days of our puerto rico trip. The rooms were rustic, but sufficient. The restaurant was delicious and vegetarian friendly. The views, scenery, etc were breath taking. We took advantage of the limited attractions in the area. We took the yoga classes. They were taught by Steve, the owner, and were a nice way to start the morning. The massage was great, done by Micah (sp?). The hike, which was a 2 mile drive to get to, was on an asphalt road in the mountains. The 4 mile hike took us 2 hours because were took our time taking everything in. The road isn't something I"d want to drive one and we didn't see a single car the whole time. At the end, we made a mistake by not going down to the main road. We continued up hill because the directions said "keep going right." We asked some people if they saw our little red car (luckily our rental was a smart car and people noticed it). The only bad thing was that it started raining on our final morning, which put a damper on our beach plans...so we asked to stay another night...but they were fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: joe10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Grande recently and left with a mixed experience. It is tucked away up in the mountains. Getting to it is a challenge but if you simply follow the provided directions and stick to it you will be fine. We have driven to other similar resorts in S. America and have had worse driving experiences so no complaints on that score. We had also visited the Arecibo Observatory before coming to the hotel so we had to improvise with help from the locals and it still worked out okay. I had my first jarring experience as I checked in as I observed the person at the registration treat two other quests very rudely. This happened in the first 10 minutes of arriving and I never quite got over that sour experience. I think the employee's name is Carmen and was rude unintentionally because her style is naturally gruff. The rooms are basic but adequate. Each room has a balcony with a hammock. There are 2 rooms per cabin and noise travels easily between the walls. Rooms closer to the road are exposed to sounds from the passing traffic (which are surprisingly frequent for the supposedly secluded location). We were in room 19 and the first night the noise of the traffic was non-stop, with the headlights arcing in our room....this being a "mountain retreat" we did not think that our room would be so close to the street. When I asked to be moved, they said they did not have any open rooms, although I did see some unoccupied units. Oh, and the water in the shower is always lukewarm, this being OK if the weather is mild, but when we were there there were heavy downpours and and a hot shower would've helped! There is a small sized pool which was good to use. The food is alright but I would recommend you have your meals outside at smaller local eateries where you get more authentic local food and much better prices. But you will need to plan your day because you don't want to be going in/out too often. We suffered from mosquito bites on most evenings and had to use mosquito repellent often. The owner and staff are friendly and helpful. But I got the distinct sense that they were understaffed and could use more help. It is a small operation and can become inefficient quickly. When I needed extra towels I got them by hunting down anyone..a waiter or the registration person but when I needed it most (on a day of heavy rain) they were inexplicably out of extra towels due to apparent laundry problems. A big downside is their driveway up to the registration which you may need to use at least once or maybe twice to unload/load (especially useful in inclement weather). The parking lot is at street level. But this driveway up to the hotel is very narrow and can only accommodate one car at a time. Our first time up, we encountered another car coming down and we had to back out all the way to let them pass. A simple system to alert someone that there is a car already in the road would be helpful. There was also an air of condescension in the tone of the owner/employees if you asked them a question about activities. It seemed like they looked down on people who did not come there to "simply relax" or do yoga. The ideal visitor to this retreat is a couple in grunge attire who carry a glazed and distant look and can sit around all day doing nothing :-) (not that it is a bad thing, just saying). We passed by some other local accommodations including cabins by the lake that I thought would be much more fun, interesting to stay at and get in/out of. Parador Villas Sotomayor in Adjuntas is also an interesting place to stay or to visit for horseback riding. Downtown Adjuntas is worth a short visit. I am not adding any comments about weather or road conditions that the retreat has no control over but they can detract from the experience. I would say that overall I felt that it was a good relaxing experience but this place seemed to highly over-rated by clever marketing (as evidenced by all the articles and certificates posted in the tiny registration area). Perhaps over time, some of the kinks can be worked out to make it a more interesting experience (though not for me).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, rustic mountain lodge”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru1000
Reviews.Content: Casa Grande is located in a beautiful mountainous area in Central Puerto Rico. It's not the easiest to get to (get directions from their website, because GPS won't work), but is well worth the visit. The resort is small, and broken into small bungalows with 4 rooms each. One issue I had was that the walls were pretty thin, so you could hear the other guests if they didn't keep the noise down. However, the guests overall were pretty quiet and respectful of each other. Also, you can sometimes hear cars going by at night as well as the sound of the prevalent Coqui frogs. My wife really enjoyed this, so it can be a plus depending on your preference. (Same for the roosters who wake you up with a cock-a-doodle-doo at 6am:) The rooms are pretty rustic, with no TV, phones, radio, etc. There is wireless internet, however, in the common area, and the bed was comfortable. Also, the "hot" water was only lukewarm. However, we enjoyed it as part of an off-the-beaten-path experience. The resort is well managed and has a very nice restaurant with extremely reasonable prices (unlike many other upscale resorts in PR). We enjoyed a 3-course Christmas dinner for $15 each, and a terrific glass of sangria. In the morning, we had a delicious breakfast, including local coffee, granola and yogurt for $4.50. A nice hiking path starts from right on the property, and takes ~45 minutes. Also, a very clean swimming pool with great views of the surrounding mountains. They have morning yoga classes, and offer massages as well (all for a fee). The property is beautifully landscaped, with many exotic plants which are carefully labeled. Overall, we had a very enjoyable experience at Casa Grande and would go back on our next visit to PR.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful 2 day mountain retreat”
Reviews.Author: anet41
Reviews.Content: It was a challenge finding Casa Grande, but it certainly was not due to their directions................just lots of twisting, winding roads (the scenery was really spectacular). We spent 2 days.........just relaxing and swimming (nice pool). We especially loved the food, as we prefer vegetarian meals (although they had meat and fish as well). I did use the yoga studio...........loved the setting!I would definitely recommend Casa Grande!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice mountain escape”
Reviews.Author: LEJ45
Reviews.Content: At the time of booking, I had read that this place was #1 (or 2) of all hotels in Puerto Rico as ranked on Trip Advisor. Iâ€™d say that was a generous statement. Certainly the place warrants good reviews, but you had to be prepared for what youâ€™re getting yourself into. Getting to the place is an adventure, but the directions were pretty accurate. (Not too too much to do in the vicinity, though we enjoyed driving all about the mountains and small towns.) When we arrived, the place did not have power because the power lines were being worked on. Okay, so not their fault, but good thing we had a flashlight with us as night fell because the staff didnâ€™t seem too concerned. Eventually the power came back on. The rooms were very open room meaning that a good portion of the room was actually screened it (but had shutter-like contraptions to seal yourself back in). This was actually a nice touch in the humidity. Be forewarned: the rooms are bareâ€”not much to them, which was fine as we spent more of our time on the porch in the hammock. (FYI â€“ You can go to the restaurant and ask for ice if you need some.) We tried the pool one night and it was relaxing. We never once went to the restaurant. All in all, Iâ€™d recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice mountain escape.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View, charming location, great food, relaxing pool.”
Reviews.Author: glucoseboy
Reviews.Content: We went here on a whim, looking for a place to spend our anniversary weekend. It's a great place to go and relax. There's not much cell reception or network connections, but the views are beautiful, the nature trail is challenging, the pool is fantastic, the yoga class was fun, and the food was excellent. The accommodations are rustic - 4 walls, a bed, a small bathroom - but clean. Nice porches with hammocks, quiet, great for reading. No A/C but we were there in August and with the fan on at night we were comfortable sleeping. It's up in the mountains so don't worry about the heat being like San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Get lost and find jungle serenity”
Reviews.Author: djnstudios
Reviews.Content: We picked the Mountain retreat by chance while looking through other people's suggestions and it's proximity to other things we wanted to see. This was a lucky accident on our part.
