The retreat is off the beaten path and in a remote location but, we were able to find it. It provided us reasonably easy access to the places and things we wanted to see. It's hard to describe the surroundings of Casa Grande because it seems almost dream-like in it's serenity. Most people couldn't fathom living (or staying) in this kind of setting. You are literally tucked away in the mountains, with wild grapefruits, bananas and yucca growing outside your cabin door. When you wake up in the morning and watch sunrise, you witness a dreamscape emerge from the mountains as the morning fog burns off by the heat of the sun. The lodgings are rustic yet clean and well maintained. The shower was hot and refreshing. There is no air conditioning, this refers to their green thinking. I actually didn't miss the air conditioning, powerful fans cool the room enough to be comfortable. My only request for the lodging would be for the fans to be adjustable, they were all or nothing. The food was delicious. I will say that twice. The food was delicious. All meals are served family style, this can be a somewhat unforgiving way to serve food, especially if you are a foodie. It does not present the food in it's best light but, I still thoroughly enjoyed the cuisine. I got to experience local cuisines that were either new to me or presented in an unfamiliar or new style. For the most part the dishes were savory, well thought out, well prepared and flavorful. Local fruits and vegetables were incorporated into each dish. Simple old standards (like oatmeal) were prepared in a way or with ingredients that made them sing. Vegetarian options were available with each meal, some breakfasts did not include meat options. Though I eat meat, this is fine. Overall the Casa Grande Mountain Retreat was a terrific place to stay. I would certainly go back and stay with them again. One cautionary note, Google has the wrong location for this retreat. Call ahead and get directions or at least ask about the correct GPS coordinates.

Reviews.Title: “Very special place hidden in the Utuado mountains !”
Reviews.Author: Paulinka80
Reviews.Content: The first few hours I had to get used to the peace and quiet from crowded Old San Juan.. but then I fully connected with the nature in my hammock admiring my view. Food is simple but good, friendly staff, clean rooms and very well maintained garden! It's a little paradise hidden in the Utuado mountains, great place to unwind!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable Experience”
Reviews.Author: ddlong
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Puerto Rico for our honeymoon in October 2010. Casa Grande was our second stop during our tour of the island. This is an absolutely beautiful retreat with a very accomodating staff. If you are looking for a very special getaway, this is a wonderful choice. We had excellent meals outside on the veranda, tried morning yoga with Mr. Steve, and experienced a very energizing massage. I am sure some people have a hard time appreciating this "unplugged" enviroment. However, for those looking to reconnect, I can not imagine a more perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to disconnect from a busy life...”
Reviews.Author: Rakelita1982
Reviews.Content: Directions to get to Casa Grande (from their official website) left no room for error. Yes the road might be a little uncomfortable for those not used to the winding corners and the going up and down the mountains, but we got there with no problem and were greeted by Carmen who was very nice. Since the resort was not at full capacity we were able to choose our room. Rooms have no luxuries; certainly no TV, A/C (not needed, really), nor radio, but are tidy and nice, with hot water and ceiling fan. Birds serve as your alarm in the mornings,--which can be a little chilly-- and coquis serenade you at night. Breakfast was great and so was dinner. Yes, the menu is a little limited and for those who wont adventure back on the road, it might not leave you with many choices, but the food was good, well seasoned and reasonably portioned and priced. We were personally served by chef Mike Mahon, who was very nice and attentive. Yes, the walls in the rooms are thin and you can hear your neighbors or people outside... but hey, the rooms ARE made to resemble local countryside wooden cottages. Fortunately, guests were very considered and kept the noise levels down...something the staff also reinforces. The pool is small, but also kept very clean, and the water was refreshing; not too cold as locals would expect. Indeed there is not much to do other than RELAX during your stay here. But that is exactly the point. You can do yoga in the mornings (optional), walk around the paths, or adventure out and get to know the local kiosks (chinchorros) and eat some local food or fritters and turnovers. This place is also ideal for small weddings that would require the guests to stay over.....and extend the party for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to decompress.”
Reviews.Author: Averylpime
Reviews.Content: The service was above and beyond. Every person on staff was kind and eager to accommodate, despite the occasional language barrier. The remote location of Casa Grande provided the perfect atmosphere for total relaxation and rejuvenation. I wish I could have stayed for an extended stay and definitely plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the heart of Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Goodtogo11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been visiting Casa Grande Mountain Retreat for the past 5 years and our most recent visit was last week. For each and every visit we continue to be entranced by the natural and peaceful beauty of our surroundings and warmly embraced by the lovely team at Casa Grande. Casa Grande is simple and rustic â€“ a place that easily transports guests away from the hustle and bustle of urban life. On our first visit the lack of a/c, tv, radio and phone in the rooms made me wonder what the accommodations would be like, but after the first night, we instantly fell in love with the peace and tranquillity that Casa Grande offers, in part due to the absence of those very same modern-day intrusions mentioned before (although for those who have lap tops wireless internet access is now available at the restaurant). The clean, simple, functional wooden cabins provide guests with a cosy, peaceful haven, each with a private balcony which makes bird watching an easy past time to enjoy at this location. The private bathrooms are clean, fully functioning with great hot & cold water pressure and efficiently outfitted with fixtures that contribute to their eco-friendly status. The landscaping is filled with carefully nurtured mountain-side gardens and fruit trees, complete with a reflection water feature near the main building and its own waterfall (in the rainy season). The property is thoughtfully dotted with wooden benches for quiet respite â€“ all created under the guidance of owner/operator Steve Weingarten. It is the landscaping of the property which blends naturally into it surroundings that contributes greatly to the tranquillity and peacefulness that guests can escape to. Casa Grande continues to evolve in a most beautiful, thoughtful and serene manner and the latest development that adds positively to our experience is the addition of Chef Mike to the Casa Grande team. What a coup! The cuisine at Casa Grandeâ€™s Restaurant cannot be topped anywhere close in the region. The menu is a wonderful blend of new and local cuisine with superb attention to flavour and even a dash of â€˜healthyâ€™ in preparation which doesnâ€™t detract from the finish. On previous visits we would consider discovering new places to eat as part of exploring the countryside, but with Chef Mike, itâ€™s a delight to return to Casa Grande at the end of a day for a wonderfully prepared meal. Both the Chicken Florentine and Churrasco were the best we ever had â€“ way to go Chef Mike, Ilia prepared a lovely dinner for us. Breakfast is equally delightful with such creations as coconut pancakes and open-faced spinach & home made cheese omelettes. Yes, we definitely recommend taking advantage of the restaurant while staying at Casa Grande, or if youâ€™re in the region on a weekend road trip â€“ a visit to the restaurant for lunch is a perfect stop over. Although Casa Grande is 1Â½ hr drive from San Juan, the drive along the north coast is beautiful and the final destination is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent to recharge batteries”
Reviews.Author: lcordero24
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very quiet, surrounded by nature, the perfect environment to escape the daily rush of work and noises. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were nice and clean. To get there may be a little difficult but it's worth it. The pool is small but very nice, most cell phones won't get any signal nearby but that didn't bother me since I wanted to disconnect from the world. There's wi-fi in the restaurant. Food was great and there are restaurants 15-20 minutes down the road. It's the perfect getaway to recharge your batteries and disconnect from the world. There's also a guided tour to a waterfall but the guide was not available that day.

Reviews.Title: “Serene and Beautiful -- Jurassic Park With No Mean Dinosaurs”
Reviews.Author: fridaygrrl
Reviews.Content: Casa Grande is simply gorgeous. Yes the drive is a little hairy if you are not used to mountain driving, but well worth it. This is a perfect getaway for anyone needing major stress relief. We were welcomed warmly and arrived in time for a wonderful dinner on the porch. We found the food amazing and remarkably well-priced, just-right sized portions and a nice selection. A place like this could stick you with huge menu prices because there are no other options, but everything was reasonably priced and delicious. The rooms are sparse but comfortable. The lack of air conditioning is AWESOME. The ceiling fan was all we needed in the middle of August and we did not have to listen to anyone else powering up their A/Cs, which has been a problem for us in the past when we wanted quiet and fresh air. Sunday we were treated to a ginormous thunder and lightning storm in the canyon. Swinging in the hammock on our porch watching that is something I will never forget-- soul-stirring yet incredibly peaceful. You could almost imagine giant dinosaurs wandering around-- it felt quite disconnected to the modern world. We were quite surprised by the lack of biting insects-- we were able to dine outside every evening with no bug spray. The facilities, pool, bathrooms were all clean and the staff friendly. We are not yoga enthusiasts so can't comment on the the classes, but the massage was great. We will definitely return to Casa Grande-- well worth the reasonable prices and curative powers of this mountain hideaway.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, horrible food, difficult to get to!”
Reviews.Author: phobiaofwater
Reviews.Content: We were so dissappointed in this hotel! the roads to get there were so hard to travel, dangerous in many places, and when we did get there we were greeted as if we were a burden! We ate dinner there (not like there was any other choice since this property is so remote), and the food was horrible! We ordered a Shrimp kebob and a greek salad, I never have ever had shrimp so overcooked in my life!, the greek salad, well the only thing that made it greek were the black olives! the home made cheese tasted bad, and the service was horrible, not to mention the huge flying insects during dinner! The rooms were very minimalistic, we only had one glass, and no hand towels, of course we did expect it to be somewhat bare (ie no TV, no AC), but this was a bit much. We didn't feel as if the room was very clean either, lighting was so dim unable to really tell if the shower was cleaned, but the toilet had been used prior to our arrival, that was apparent! For the price we paid, we could have stayed at a resort on the beach! Never will recommend this place, never will stay there again especially since there are much nicer places in this country to stay! One positive note: the grounds were beautiful, hard not to be up in the mountain forests!

Reviews.Title: “A restorative retreat, natural beauty...”
Reviews.Author: pabon2
Reviews.Content: For an hour and a half on the porch facing a hillside of banana plants and hanging vines, mango and fern trees, orange trees within reach, it was so quiet in the late morning that there was only the sound of the triplet calls of the reinita, the bananaquit, on the branch building a nest at the end of the porch. From the wind through the valley, the broad wings of fern trees rose and fell. A mile down the road, a colony of white egrets was embedded in the thickly grown trees on the far side of the river. Far from the bulla of mid-town calls, traffic, speed, and pressure, I found a staff that was welcoming, but not intrusive, and Casa Grande the place where I learned how to be present to myself and the world again. Open to the hills that rise up around it, the location is filled with constantly changing light from sunrise to nightfall... Night, especially after rain, is a whole fabric of sounds, crickets and tiny frogs (coquies). Bats clear the night air of insects, and I discovered island fireflies that do not flash, but stay lit... And yes, there are tiny lizards that pause and scoot past outside, as you enter or leave your cabin. There are times when group workshops are scheduled, weddings or other gatherings, and then it is a place full of festive commotion. Other time you, alone, or with your companion(s) will feel like you have the place to yourselves, just to be... Or to take a cool swim to be refreshed from the sun's heat. Since his arrival in May 2010, Mike, the new chef, has designed a creative and tasty menu for a variety of tastes (I found his appetizers especially appealing) with a vegetarian option -- Jose has an encyclopedic knowledge of every path, nook, and cranny of the surrounding hills, and the owner, Steve, brings his wisdom and experience to the morning yoga classes to prepare us for the day. I stumbled on Casa Grande a few years ago, and have returned regularly for brief restorative stays... The textures of wind, light, leaves, mist, and sound have revealed themselves differently at each visit. I used up memory cards on my digital camera, as I explored the different plantings around the property, met a Puerto Rican Screech Owl and its fledgling while sitting on a bench on the trail loop, and concluded that photographers, botanists, painters, walkers, birders, yogis, and writers would never tire of the natural phenomena here or in the immediately surrounding region. Someone once wrote, "Be here, now..." You will have to see for yourself -- but I found what a special place this was for me to learn and practice these words.

Reviews.Title: “Go to Hacienda Gripinas (Jayuya) instead!”
Reviews.Author: theTruth_OK
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this place was HORRIBLE! I traveled with my famiy for my birthday celebration and did not enjoy it at all. The room assigned to us consisted of two queen-sized beds, one (1) ceiling fan, and a stinky bathroom. The ceiling fan was not enough to alleviate the heat generated by the sun hitting the zinc ceiling of our room. At night, ants would crawl to our beds and sting us. I thought it was just me, but the three of us were complaining in the morning because of all the stings that we had. It is very expensive for what they offer! They don't include breakfast, or dinner (however, Gripinas does it for the same price). The food was not great (I have had better) and was overpriced for the few ounces of meat that they offer. Massages were VERY NICE and the service people were friendly, but overall, the place was filthy and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway to relax”
Reviews.Author: dante007
Reviews.Content: I choosed CG for 1 night stay cause I was on my way from Arecibo to southern coast. Location - it was quite far from bigger civilization but this was fact I knew before so it wasn't surprise for that I need to drive by mountain roads. As I have done such a driving before in other countries so there was nothing special or aggravating. I loved that there was no GSM signal, so I didn't had to worry about calls from office. Amenities - of course we used a pool. It was very relaxing. Only I wish that they would allow to use it in the late evening also. My friends took morning yoga lesson and were very satisfied. They said it was just what they needed after 1 week business trip. I also took a little hiking trip what they offer free of charge but it was too easy and actually there was nothing special to see except of huge amount of spider nets. So if You have experienced such a forests before there will be nothing new to You. Rooms - I had a twin room (no. 7) and it was very simple but enough. On the terrace was also hammock for night sleep. If You are a couple and want some privacy I suggest to ask room no. 7. Even if there was no AC and I was there during hot season the fan was enough and sleep I took was absolutely perfect. Food - we only ate breakfast and it was normal. For dinner we just drove up to hill and found one local bar. They offered some food (8-10USD) what was nothing special. Overall - I would go there again. As I'm not able to do nothing more than 1 day it would be hard to me stay in such a place more than couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Bugged”
Reviews.Author: katzefrau
Reviews.Content: The good part first, the hotel was in a beautiful setting & the food was tasty. Now my qualms with this place is it is off some really twisty roads in the middle of nowhere. Once you're at Casa Grande you don't really want to go anywhere because you have to traverse those roads again. It would have been appreciated if they had given us a heads up when we called just how crazy the roads were. We ended up getting there at night and part of one road was washed out, there was a horse around one corner, a dog at the next etc. It was pretty scary. We were having some transport troubles and we tried to cancel our reservation a few days in advance but note that you need to give seven days advance notice, end of story. My other qualm with this place was the bugs. The 1st night there were some. The 2nd night we were literally assaulted by them. We were reading quietly in our bed & they just kept coming. We had a pitcher of water in our room, it was filled with them. They littered our pillows. I understand in a natural setting there is bound to be some "wildlife" but this was ridiculous. I slept with the sheet over my head. When we checked out I saw them cleaning a mass of bugs off the countertop so it wasn't just us.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed and overexposed”
Reviews.Author: harris39
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I drove onto the Casa Grande Mountain Retreat, we though we had entered paradise. The grounds are beautiful and serene, and we were so excited for our night's stay there. Unfortunately, everything went downhill from there. Our cabin was relatively bare, and I suppose we should have read the website closer because we were rather dismayed to find that all rooms are cooled only by ceiling fans and the mountain breeze. Also, because the resort's m.o. is a place to unplug and getaway, there are no televisions and also no internet. Not a deal-breaker, but just want to give everyone a fair warning about what you'll be getting. Every cabin has it's own deck with a hammock, which is very appealing, but unfortunately relatively useless during mosquito season as we were ravaged by bugs as soon as we stepped outside. We found we could also not keep our shutters open on our windows because several of them had rather large holes in the screens so mosquitos kept getting into our cabin. So, unfortunately, we weren't able to profit from any mountain breezes and because the power kept going out during the night, our overhead fan would intermittently stop working which meant our room was rather humid and unpleasant. We tried to read, but the lights appeared to attract more bugs, because along with the mosquitos, we kept finding many other bugs crawling over our sheets while the lights were on. Moreover, if you're not really into nature, this just isn't the place for you because several lizards crept into our room under the door and camped out with us during the night. There is also a main road right beneath the retreat which several noisy trucks drive by on, so don't expect a night that is punctuated solely by the sounds of wildlife. All in all, this didn't provide for a restful, relaxing night of sleep! We also had the misfortune of visiting the retreat while a large group on a yoga retreat were there. This meant there wasn't much privacy, and we were placed next to a noisy family that we could hear well into the night (and who didn't realize they didn't need to slam their door every time they left their cabin). Normally we wouldn't be bothered by a large group being at the resort, but unfortunately this impacted the menu at the restaurant that evening. We were offered the vegetarian buffet with the option of a side-portion of meat which we decided to do since dining options aren't abundant in that area. This was a mistake. The buffet was TERRIBLE. It consisted of a gluey tortilla soup (black bean with soggy tortilla strips in it), a green salad, falafel, and white rice, plus cake made from a boxed-mix for dessert. Insipid at best (and by far the worst food we ate while in Puerto Rico), the true insult came when we wound up paying $40 (for two people) for this meal. If you do stay here, do yourself a favor and eat anywhere else! As others have mentioned, the staff didn't feel very welcoming, and didn't really offer us any suggestions of attractions or activities to take part in while in the area. We left feeling like we had paid an awful lot of money for an ok view (the views must be better if you get a cabin higher up the mountain), but not much else. It was kind of like camping in a wooden tent, which may be what some crave but didn't do it for us and we really felt we didn't get an experience worth what we paid. Perhaps if you went during a time when it wasn't quite so hot and buggy you would better enjoy yourself, but for us, this was the low point of our time in Puerto Rico. We'd highly recommend staying elsewhere for a more authentic island experience. We will return to Puerto Rico, but not to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, and serene retreat”
Reviews.Author: NorthDallasDan
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this fabulous place. It was just what we needed--quiet, BEAUTIFUL, and very relaxing! It was cloudy when we visited and I just loved the way the clouds hung low to the mountainside. The sounds of the wildlife permeated our room (which was quite comfortable by the way). The staff was very friendly and helpful in arranging a hiking/tubing cave tour for us. Definitely plan on eating at least one dinner at the hotel, the chef was great--it's worth it. Only one recommendation for potential travellers--stay more than one night!--you will wish you had if you don't!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: glamy22
Reviews.Content: I attended a Bootcamp for Goddess weekend in Casa Grande and we love it. I'm from Puerto Rico and a have never been there. I was so proud of such a beautiful simple place. "Less is more", very peaceful, great views and the food, OMG deliciosa!!! Mike the Chef is the best, he was very in to everything, we love his and Steve services. I will come back soon!!! Mike, I want chickpeas burgers please!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great view and setting, crappy service, barely adequate rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelswrites
Reviews.Content: The front desk owner answers questions with minimal information. He kindly offered to move us away from a very loud family with young children. This was key since the rooms have no AC and you must sleep with the screened windows open. The benefit of sleeping with the windows open is the amazing night sounds of insects and frogs that surrounds you. The room he sent us to (climbing) was unmade. When we climbed down again to the reception area, he was horrified and apolgetic, and then sent us (climbing further) to an isolated room at the back end (peaceful). There was a dead, decomposing lizard on the bed. We had to go back to the reception and get new bedding. He offered to move us AGAIN but we were already unpacked. A different guest, who became our friend, thought the owner was downright surly, but I wouldn't go that far. The dinner food was good, except, there at the ecolodge, they had none of their salads available. I could have chosen tofu for a vegetarian dish. Had kebobs instead. In the morning breakfast isn't served until 8 am (impossible if you have an appointment at the caves or ziplining) and the waitress was sluggish and drowsy. The good stuff -- there's a small clean pool. The setting woudl be hard to beat with a view of the rainforest and river below, and the frogs and flowers all around you. Not so easy to find in the dark. Get a very good driving road map. The rooms were extremely basic, but clean enough (except ours unfortunately), with high ceilings and individual lanais. Don't go there if you can't climb steps.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in the tropics”
Reviews.Author: zachary22
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife decided on Casa Grande for our wedding, based solely on the website and some correspondence with Steve, the owner. While we would have liked to have seen it first, time did not allow us to visit beforehand. Whether it was luck or divine guidance, I'm sure we found one of the best places for destination weddings in the world! It was perfect. The setting is jaw-droppingly gorgeous, with many hikes and things to do without ever leaving the resort. It was isolated enough that we felt secluded, but not so much that our guests got lost. We had a wide range of people attend, from older family with health problems, to children, to people with terminal fear of jungle spiders, and they all loved it. Everybody loved it. I really could not recommend it enough. The food is simply the best- wholesome, healthy, and most importantly delicious, and chef Mike was great about people with food allergies. Steve is very helpful and really knows how to make you feel at home. He helped us arrange the cake, flowers, negotiations, everything. There was even a major storm the day before that knocked the power out- but we didn't notice because they were prepared with a generator. Two concerns our guests had about Casa Grande were the lack of AC and the distance from the airport. By the end of the trip, everyone was thrilled with the experience, I didn't hear a single complaint. Temperature was not a problem, we even got a bit cold at night! It does get warm in the day, but the pool is always there and no one seemed to mind, even people from much colder climates. The location is out of the way (purposefully so) but that's part of the charm. Distances in the mountains can be deceptive, so do allow time if you decide to visit any far off areas. In short, book this place now before it's discovered by everyone else and becomes 4 times the price. :)

Reviews.Title: “Ecological experience”
Reviews.Author: Gio10_10
Reviews.Content: Refreshing natural springwater pool. In this place, the local coqui frogs and lizards outnumber us humans by a large number. The surroundings are nothing short of beautiful if not spectacular. Also, the food that comes out of the kitchen is superb, something you would expect in a fine restaurant in a large city, but in the unlikeliest of places. The breakfasts we had here were the best in the island. (VEry nice combination of modern with local island flavors) The prices are also very reasonable. The only bad: The walls of the rooms are paper-thin, so if you have rowdy next door neighbors, like we did, you might be up for a while. Overall, a pleasant experience. If you want to get away from it all, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, clean, quiet, skimpy on the food”
Reviews.Author: mtennis131
Reviews.Content: Our room had lovely view with a balcony overlooking the mountains. We went for the scenery, so we didn't mind that there were no telephones or TV. The rooms didn't have airconditioning, but you certainly don't need it in the mountains. If you don't like the sounds of birds, frogs and the morning roosters, you'll probably want to bring ear plugs. My husband loved the background noise, I plugged my ears. We were disappointed in the food though. What we ordered didn't have a lot of seasoning, and the breafast dishes were very skimpy. It's the first restaurant I've been to that gave you one slice of unbuttered toast at breakfast (and it wasn't even good bread) They did offer yoga and massages, but I can't comment on the quality since we were too busy hiking and seeing the sights to take advantage of them.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: floreb
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place to visit, centrally located cloe to everything you would want to see in PR. The FOOD was amazing. The best I have every tried. Very good about diet restrictions and allergies. A MUST for all travelers

Reviews.Title: “Shoot the rooster! Keep everything else”
Reviews.Author: polycloud
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were here on our anniversary. This place is very simple but beautiful. We loved watching the sun set over the mountains and the pool shimmering at night. There were too many lights to see the stars clearly. Food is expensive here. Our breakfast for 2 cost $30 (we were hungry but thought that was a bit steep). Our recommendation is that they shoot the rooster. It started crowing early in the morning and wouldn't stop. There was one stray dog, quite cute, but was barking early in the morning too. We both had ear plugs but it was impossible to block out those sounds. The place was remarkably bug-free. No mosquitoes or gnats. Just a few ants. That was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Magical!!!”
Reviews.Author: daner68
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed here for 2 nights and I cried when we had to leave. I wish we had stayed longer! the views and grounds are amazing!! Steve (the owner) does such a great job of making it beautiful. Everyone that works there is so nice and made us feel like we had known them forever. The restaurant was soooo yummy! loved the food! the pool was small but, so beautiful. We needed a place to REALLY relax and Casa Grande makes it happen. The rooms are clean and comfortable. We sat outside at night to listen to the jungle and watch the bats. We also had massages! wonderful! We are already planning another trip! but longer!

Reviews.Title: “Simplicity at its Best!”
Reviews.Author: phono-holic
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Casa Grande, and it was wonderful. Our only regret is that we did not stay longer. The rooms are very clean, comfortable, and simple. In our case, a ceiling fan, queen-size bed, side tables, low dresser with mirror, a chair, and several "California Closet" style bins. It sounds like a lot of furniture, but it isn't. Somehow, the room seems very spacious. The on site restaurant provides good food for a reasonable price. Breakfast is served until 10:00 AM, so you can feel free to sleep in. Dinner options were varied and we enjoyed sitting on the covered veranda in the evening. Afterwords, we would sit on the porch outside our room. You are either going to love or hate the coqui frogs. Personally, I found the background noise of the frogs very soothing. I typically have trouble sleeping - not here! The coffee is sometimes made a little strong, in the Puerto Rican fashion, but when asked, they quickly remade it a little thinner. I will be back for a much longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, warm staff, beautiful setting, delicious food”
Reviews.Author: mwsfe
Reviews.Content: I recommend the Casa Grande Mountain Retreat without hesitation. We had been staying in a coastal area that was beautiful but loud with the noises of city life in addition to the surf. Coming to this part of the island was important to us as the rugged, lush landscape of karst country is stunningly beautiful and it gave us a completely different perspective on the island. When you see the jagged peaks of this area you will understand why, outside of the main road which was blasted straight through from the North, it is necessary to wind your way through mountain roads to reach the secluded corners of the area. Open the windows and you will hear the sound of roosters as you wend your way to this beautiful former coffee plantation about 1/2 hr from the main road. The gardens are lush and attended with great care. The staff are warm and welcoming, including the owner Steve, who instructs a relaxing and energizing yoga class in the morning. When we stayed, a new chef had just arrived, and the food was incredible â€“ a small menu with excellent ingredients and perfectly prepared. The rooms are very simply furnished with no telephone, TV, etcâ€¦are these necessities or modern distractions? Stay here if the answer is right. Take it slow, listen to the sounds of the forest, float in the pool, take a stroll through the grounds on the path above the hotel, and if it rains, lie down in the hammock and listen to it shower the area for a while. I will remember this place fondly for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful mountain retreat”
Reviews.Author: Nellyvader
Reviews.Content: I had two lovely days and nights here. I practiced yoga in the morning with Steve, the owner, and lounged and did some leisurely exploring during the day. The vegetarian offerings at dinner were simple and deliciously prepared. I definitely would return.

Reviews.Title: “Serene, beautiful, well run retreat from "civilization"”
Reviews.Author: betsyk2201
Reviews.Content: Our experience with the staff and owner of Casa Grande was exceptional. Everyone was friendly, prompt and provided excellent service both in the rooms and in the dining area. The accommodations were sparse but adequate. The real treat was being able to sit outside in the evenings and watch the shadows slide over the mountains and tropical forest as the sun set. The only suggestion I would make is to do a replacement of the beds as soon as it is economically feasible. Ours was not the most comfortable. We will return to the wonderful place and bring members of our families with us!

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Heaven, Yoga and a massage ( and Zipline!)”
Reviews.Author: bertmerc
Reviews.Content: My wife and a friend and I just stayed there in February (2010) and had a fantastic time. If youâ€™re looking for a place with a TV, phone, Internet, etc., this place is not for you. Weâ€™ve stayed here many times and this was definitely one of our best. We got a great massage, went swimming and even went â€œzipliningâ€� at the Batey Zipline Adventure located near the â€œCaguana Indian Ceremonial Park (which we have visited in the past)â€� about 40 minutes from Casa Grande. This is just peace and quiet and can be started off with Yoga in the morning with Steve (the owner) followed by a great breakfast. Then you can take in the area attractions or just lounge around the pool. We did both. Probably the best part is going to sleep at night listening to all of mother natureâ€™s creatures. Give yourself at least 3 days. If you only stay one day, youâ€™ll want to come for more; we did!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected, very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LilyStarInterlaken
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this place is very isolated and hard to get to - think curvy (almost switchbacks) steep roads. If you're looking for a place where there is nothing to do and you don't want to be bothered by anyone, this is the place for you. The grounds are especially beautiful and there are a couple of nature trails but we were unable to use them because it rained the entire three days we were there. We had to walk across a little bridge to get our cabin and it was a little frightening because the boards were "spongy", i.e. it felt like they were about to rot through. The room itself was a little on the shabby side. On the plus side it looked like they had recently replaced the sink and toilet in the bathroom. On the negative side, no air conditioning means dampness and maybe our experience was worse because it rained everyday, but all of our clothes, even the clean ones were always damp. They had installed some, what looked like new, wire bins to keep your belongings in to deal with that problem I guess, but it didn't work for us. Our room had two double beds which were both pushed up against the wall so whoever had to sleep on the inside had to crawl over the other person if they had to go to the bathroom in the night. The room had very poor lighting so reading after dark was not an option. It appears the place is run on a shoestring - - they couldn't even come up with a cold bottle of water for me. We had breakfast in the restaurant the first morning but my food wasn't very good - - although my husband says his was quite good. The service in the restaurant wasn't very good either. when I picked up my fork to eat, I noticed it had dried food on it and the waiter never came back to check on us so I ate my eggs with my spoon. My experience may be colored by all the rain while we were there - - nothing to do and traveling anywhere was challenging due to the roads and isolation, but I did notice a sign saying that if you booked more than one night and left early, you would still be charged for the nights that you booked. That tells me that other people have arrived, been disappointed and left or wanted to leave early too. I would say if you wanted to try this place to only stay one night.

Reviews.Title: “We sat on the balcony listening to the coqui at night”
Reviews.Author: woofNewYork
Reviews.Content: Casa Grande is situated on the side of a mountain with a river gorge below and mountains on all sides. The view is excelllent. and there are flowers and tropoical plants everywhere. We couuldn't ask for a more beautiful setting. The food was very good, especially the fresh fruit for breakfast. The staff was helpful and extremely friendly. The room was ample since we only used it for sleeping. There are plenty of steps to reach the cabins, especially #1 & 2, but it was good exercise. I am 84 years old and my grandchildren are 2 and 4. We had no complaints about the stairs. We couldn't get the children out of the pool. We spent time visiting the radio telescope and the caves and took a boat trip aroound the nearby lake. Walking on a flat dirt road around was very easy and beautiful. What is there not to like after coming from Montreal and New York after a rough winter. Arthur at LAXERPHOTO @earthlnink.net

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, great relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: mlgma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and had a wonderful time. The location is amazing, you are really right in the forest with beautiful trees and flowers all around. We didn't have reservations as we had planned to stay in Jayuya, but our hotel there was so awful we had to find another place. I remembered that I was also considering Casa Grande, but I think I chose the other place because it was a little less expensive. Casa Grande is worth every penny! The pool was beautiful and heated too. We walked on the trail on the property which was perfect for our family with our 7 and 4 year old daughters. We also took the boat across the lake for lunch which was really fun and a unique experience. The food was great and had a vegetarian option for dinner. My only slight complaint was that the vegetarian selection was the same both nights. It rained both days we were here, but it was beautiful and extemely peaceful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Remote calming mountain retreat”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTom
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 2 nights at Casa Grande during our honeymoon, and loved the restful mountain environment. The gardens and small pool are very nice. The breakfast and dinner buffets are fairly tasty, but we look forward to improvements with the new chef arriving in a month. The trail on the retreat's property is for adventurous healthy folk. The bed and sheets were great. We were unable to get the free WiFi to work, but other guests were successful. Our Verizon cellphone worked great here. It's a very mountainous environment, so be ready to climb 15 stairs to get to your room. The walls are thin--we heard some nocturnal joy from the room next door--but the rest of the time the loudest noise was relaxing sound of tree frogs and birds outside. The only other issue we found is that the shower temperature leaps when someone flushes the toilet in the adjacent bathroom. There are cute little lizards on the grounds just like other places we stayed in Puerto Rico. Both mainland Americans and Puerto Ricans stay here, and it's a good opportunity to meet other people and share ideas. It's a great base for activities in central Puerto Rico, including Toro Negro forest and the Caguana Indian Ceremonial Park. We want to go back for an adventurous Camuy cave excursion, as the basic public tour involved hours of queueing (and the movie theater was broken and every one of the other interesting cave tours were closed). We came by way of Ponce, and found ourselves driving in the mountains after dark. I'm very used to twisty mountain roads, but Puerto Rican drivers often bizarrely drive on the wrong side of the road, so I strongly recommend arriving during daylight! (If you're coming from San Juan, I understand it's less of an issue because most of the route is along Highway 10.) We found our Nuvi GPS quite helpful when we told it to go to Casa Grande at coordinates (-66.64167,18.28417). We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, charming, relaxing - we loved it and would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: jules732
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent a week in PR, rented a car, and drove around the country. We stayed at Casa Grande for two nights, and loved it. I've read some of the other reviews on here, and I can attest that you can easily hear other guests in adjacent rooms, but it was not a problem for us. (Hopefully, we weren't a problem for anyone else, either!) Our room did not have AC, but the screened windows have shutters that can open wide, and the fan is so powerful, it cools things down in minutes. We loved having the windows open at night so we could hear all the coqui and other animals that were active at night. I enjoy camping, so to me, this was an upgraded version of it - I got to hear the amazing sounds all night and morning, but had a comfortable bed, stayed dry (it poured one night, which sounded amazing, but would have been terrible in a tent!), and could still sleep in without getting too hot. Each room also had a hammock, which my friend and I had to take turns on. It was so relaxing to just lay there and read. We had some lizard guests each night, which we thought was funny. My husband wouldn't have though - he's afraid of reptiles. We didn't see any bugs in our room though, so we were happy. The pool is refreshing after being out exploring the island all day. We actually loved the food. We had quickly found that the small towns around PR only have friend food available, and had resorted to buying bread, peanut butter, and honey to survive the days. We were excited to have some "American" good at casa grande, and it was so filling - and welcome after the long days. We also loved the drinks. I got sangria, and my friend got LIT's both nights. We hoped to get massages while there, but the masseuse was sick. Oh well. We understand. We were too tired to get up for morning yoga! But it was available. Other than that, it was a great location, beautiful grounds, etc. etc. We both said we'd go back again if ever in PR again. I have a friend heading there this summer, and I'm recommending she stop here. Thanks for a relaxing visit! We wish we had more time there!

Reviews.Title: “Mountain Heaven”
Reviews.Author: usually_happy64
Reviews.Content: I was extremely nervous about staying here. My guy wanted to stay in the Central Mountain Area of Puerto Rico and this seemed like the best choice. The reason I was nervous was because it sounded too much like camping, no air conditioning, no radio, no television, and no phone service. I do not go camping because I like the creature comforts of life. Still I must say I would happily return. The grounds are beautiful; but not artificially manicured. It feels as if you are viewing nature at its best. I also appreciated that the plants were labeled. Just resting in the hammock which is on every porch is worth the cost of admission. But there is moreâ€¦the room, while basic, is not without merit. There is plenty of storage space, a dresser with six drawers, a wire bin system with four more drawers and a good sized night stand on both sides of the bed with another good sized drawer as well as a shelf. There is also an open closet with half a dozen hangers. The bathroom has lots of hooks and places to hang towels to dry. While I read some reviews saying there was no cell phone coverage I was able to get decent coverage with my Verizon. Above and beyond the comfort of the room was the attitude of the staff. Everyone who works there seems to be happy. Everyone is willing to take time to do what ever you need to make your stay more comfortable. The ladies at the desk learned quickly enough that I like lots of towels and ice. Even though this is a very Green establish, they never once gave me any reason to feel that they did not approve of my need for clean towels and ice. I was always helped with a smile. Having said that they were all wonderful, I would like to say that Rose, who manned the desk and gave us great suggestions and Jose who did a number of jobs at Casa Grande and was always our waiter at dinner were especially appreciated. We took the meal plan because we did not want to drive the mountain roads after dinner in the dark. This was a good decision. The food was quite good and on the first evening it seemed there was a good variety. In fact there is a good variety if you stay one of two nights. We were there four nights and I did get tired of always having the same hot vegetable and the same fish choices. The food was quite tasty and if you are going to eat there, it is far less expensive to buy the plan. Having said that, I would say the cost is reasonable in either case. There is a lovely swimming pool fed by mountain streams. My few warnings: We needed to climb 33 steps every time we went to our room. There was another flight from the parking lot to the main area. You are, after all, in mountains. If you are not physically capable of doing this please be sure to check if there is any other way you can be accommodated. I did not see ramps or elevators. In his need to be Green the owner got a little carried away. Of course he eliminates some waste by encouraging reusing linens, not offering air conditioning and such. But the fact that the room and bathroom were very poorly lit drove me to distraction. There are very few lights and those that are there must have a very low wattage. There are two reading lights mounted on the wall over the bed and they do a good job of lighting the way to read. But they do not light any other part of the room. The one light over the mirror was almost useless. Fortunately, when I left I recovered my sight. We had a great room which looked out towards the mountains. We could watch the mountains peeking above some clouds. It seemed to me that some rooms facing the other way had a lesser view. I was pleased to be able to lie in that hammock and study the beauty of Puerto Rico. Casa Grande is in a lovely part of Puerto Rico and I would return, but I would not stay more than two or three nights.

Reviews.Title: “this is not a yoga retreat”
Reviews.Author: calstron
Reviews.Content: although we all know yogis should not be judgemental be feel that we were mislead by the casa grande website. The name of the place has the word "retreat" and the words "yoga" and "kripalu" appear multiple times on the homepage of the website. When we arrived we were appalled to find that the 1 yoga class offerred daily came with a $12/person additional charge ($oga?). We sighed and paid and were then disappointed to find that it was senior citizen yoga (apparrently even a down dog was considered too strenuous). We were not the only guests who were disappointed in the same way. Fourtunately the yoga room (which is always kept locked) is available (get key at front desk) and we were able to do our own practice. That having been said, the environment is stunningly beautiful, the rooms are clean, and the food is good(american prices, american portions) If you are looking for a place to "chill", this would be a place. Also, don't be fooled by the "less than 2 hours from San Juan". We left 4 1/2 hrs. before our flight departure and barely made it (puerto rican highway infrastructure)

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted - mountain escape”
Reviews.Author: beachbird2340
Reviews.Content: Casa Grande was the perfect location for our 4 day escape to enjoy hiking, birding and relaxing. Morning yoga set the tone for the day with restorative sessions surrounded by lush flowers and vegetation and serenaded by birds and coqui. Staff members were friendly and pleasant and the canine yogi was a special part of the experience. We enjoyed the night sounds and found them soothing (except for the neighbor's confused rooster!) The other reviews that were not positive are the exception, as the other guests in house during our stay seemed very satisfied as well.

Reviews.Title: “All of the discomforts of a kid's summer camp at adult prices”
Reviews.Author: jamaicatrip2
Reviews.Content: Since Casa Grande is one of the few choices in the area, staying there may be necessary but use these tips to prepare yourself; 1. You will hear every noise, conversation and bodily function of guests in several adjacent cabins. Other guests told us they used ear plugs because they read the Trip Advisor reviews in advance. (Really, after all of the complaints about this problem the owner should address this) 2. There are no blankets on the beds or in the room (the night we were there it was freezing and miserably damp) 3. Despite prominently displayed framed magazine articles describing gourmet vegetarian food the only dinner offering was a buffet with cheap puffy white bread, very very bland lukewarm spaghetti, unimaginative stir-fried caulifower, something akin to Hamburger Helper and rice. Any elementary school cafeteria could do as well. The cost of the buffet was about $40 for 2. Breakfast was a buffet of hard boiled egg and toast or oatmeal with an anemic fruit tray of a few tiny orange slices and pineapple. Coffee, tea and juice. $18 for 2. If you stay at Casa Grande I suggest you eat at Rancho Marina on nearby Lago Dos Bocas. 4. The on-ground walk was a disappointment - narrow, twisting and slippery with no view. Don't bother. 5. The cabins are very near a roadâ€”sirens, boom boxes and road noise are surprisingly frequent for such a remote area. They do die down at night. 6. The walkways are run down and make a depressing entrance to your room. It was the worst stay and the worst food we had in 10 days in Puerto Rico. What was positive? The pool is very clean and nicely situated, a bit chilly but refreshing after a walk. The rooms are spartan but have some nice photos for decoration and wire baskets to store things.The view from dining deck is lovey and there are many interesting plants on the grounds. Roosters crowing and animals noises are part of the atmosphere. The drive there is not really very hard, a few twists but the directions provided were clear.

Reviews.Title: “Mountain retreat, great views, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: GiselaZD
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Casa Grande Mountain Retreat. It is located off a narrow, quiet, country road. There is some local traffic but it's very quiet overall. We could hear Puerto RIcan screech owls at night and they make some very cool sounds. Room was basic but clean and comfortable. The view from our hammock was pretty fabulous. We had our meals on the dining room balcony looking out over the forested hills. Food was good and it's very convenient to have the meal plan. The staff was friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed the 4 km walk up into the hills and then taking a swim in their nice pool to cool off. One day we drove to the Bosque Toro Negro, a national forest, to hike. We drove on a portion of the Panoramic Route and had some great views. Take note that in Puerto Rico you should ask how long it will take to get somewhere rather than how far away it is. If you get off the big highways along the coasts onto the smaller roads you'll find there are many narrow twisting roads and lots of hills that make for slow going.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Retreat”
Reviews.Author: LeopardSpot
Reviews.Content: We spent a lovely night here on our drive around Puerto Rico. After negotiating our way through the hectic roads (dodging horses, chickens and stray dogs) we were releaved to be away from the hustle and bustle and spend a night quietly tucked away in the tree tops. The food was incredible - proper Puerto Rican fare and great local coffee. We loved the no TV or radio policy and ejoyed falling asleep to the sound of crickets and coquis. We decided to get up early for a private yoga session with Steve. Even as yoga novices we found this a really gentle way to welcome the day and energise before we continued on our journey. We enjoyed our time here much more than staying in the fancy El San Juan hotel and casino. This is a real Puerto Rican experience.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Stringbean57
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and had a relaxing 2 night stay a Casa Grande. Both receptionists was very nice and helpful. Room was basic but comfortable. Grounds were full of beautiful plants and the pool was very relaxing. The best thing I had at the restaurant was the Chicken Stew. Unfortunately we where there over Christmas Eve and Christmas morning so the regular menu was not available. Just a buffet that was sparse, bland and overpriced. The walls are thin and you can hear everything and if you get a room near the road, there is some light traffic occasionally. We visited the Arecibo Observatory and Camuy caves before we went to the hotel. We had the last tour at the Camuy caves and left at 5:00pm and reached Casa Grande at 6:15pm just as it was getting dark. Not sure if I would want to be driving the narrow mountain roads up to the resort at night. Overall we had a very nice stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back”
Reviews.Author: Pam_David
Reviews.Content: Having read all of the positive reviews, I was so excited for the portion of our trip where my husband and I would stay at Casa Grande. Let me start by saying every other review is right -- it is a gorgeous location with a nice pool, good food and, yes, a hammock on your deck. Now, let me share some things that no one told us. Part of the rustic retreat experience was no air conditioning, just big fans in the room (which we knew about before we got there). The temperature wasn't an issue, even in tropical Puerto Rico. However, the open windows had a few side effects that bear thought... The romantic portion of our trip ended since everyone could hear everything that was going on in every room. Oh, and I can't forget the roosters. They start crowing around 3:45 a.m. and continue throughout the rest of the early morning hours. Each bungalow nestled in the hills (sounds gorgeous, no?) is divided into 4 rooms. The walls were THIN. I mean, THIN. I mean my husband was up the first night listening to the man snoring in the other room. I was up the third night listening to the guy watching Family Guy on his computer (no tv's). Since the front desk was closed already, we had to go to the room and ask them to turn it off. Speaking of the front desk, I must admit that I never got a real friendly vibe. With only 20 rooms, I really thought it would be a more personable experience, but it wasn't. Also, on our bill at checkout, we had incorrect charges on it. They took them off, but we had to repeat over and over that we didn't incur the charge. Lastly, I'd like to discuss meals. It is fortunate that their meals were good, because they are up a narrow, winding mountain road. At sundown, it is dark, pitch black. We've driven all over the world and were very happy to know that we didn't have to go find somewhere to eat and drive on the winding, dark roads. Definitely do the meal plan if you decide to stay. If you do end up in the area, I strongly, strongly suggest you go see Batey Ziplines. Jorge is a very cool guy who has an extremely fun (and safe) adult playground of ziplines, rapelling, hiking, etc. You know it's an interesting day when you are happy that the challenge you are facing is "just" a zipline. Our day with him and his warm, friendly guys is a highlight of our entire trip!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous place!”
Reviews.Author: BCape
Reviews.Content: So to start with, the ride there is not that bad. Don' get me wrong you have to pay attention and honk your horn when going around corners, but it was not that bad. Don't let the other reviews scare you. Once you arrive at the Casa Grande, you will see that the drive there was worth it. The views are stunning and both my husband and I both think it is one of the most gorgeous views we have ever experienced. We stayed in room 16 which has two full sized beds and was on the lower level of the hillside retreat. You could hear the road below occasionally, but it was not a big deal. Our room had a lovely looking bathroom that was beyond my expectations, two fairly comfortable beds, a ceiling fan and a porch hammock. The room does not have windows, but screens that have slats you can close for more privacy. Having read the reviews prior to coming here my husband and I were expecting to hear the people in the next room breathing, but that did not happen. You could hear coughing and some hushed talking, but again, not deal breakers. We ordered the inclusive package which I would recommend. It included dinner and breakfast. The day that we were there, there was a buffet for both dinner and breakfast. The people that did not have the all inclusive package had an 18% gratuity added to their meals which they seemed a bit annoyed by. The gratuity charge is charged for drinks not included in the food package, but was not a big deal for us. Food was so-so, but trust me you don't exactly want to go driving around at night searching for food, it's much nicer to just stay put. We did, however, bring snacks with us though which I would recommend. There is a Walgreens to stop at right before you get on the smaller roads to the retreat, I think it's at the end of Rt. 10, so getting some provisions to hold you over would be helpful if you're the snacky type like us. The retreat did have internet access and it worked pretty well from the porch/reception area. One minor gripe was that some of the walkways needed some paint/love, but other than that no real complaints. This stop on our trip saved our image of Puerto Rico and I suggest you make it a focal point of your trip to the island!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful nature all around and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: seasand55
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the beautiful nature that surrounds you in this great resort in the mountains of Utuado. The rustic but comfortable rooms with balconies right on the mountainside were wonderful. Relaxing while reading a book on the hammock was heaven. The food in the resort is healthy but tasty and plentiful. Noise does carry and from reading prior reviews I had brought ear plugs that did the trick. My boyfriend hiked the trail on site and it's not for the beginners. Lunch at Rancho Marina in Lago Dos Bocas was delicious and the service was amazing! Highly recommend the churrasco with Rancho sauce, specialty of the house. The food was so good that it's worth going there even on just a day trip. All in all, a great, romantic, peaceful and relaxing getaway! After our stay we went to Caguana Parque Indigena but it's not worth the trip because Tibes in Ponce is much bigger and educational if you want to learn about the Taino indians that inhabited the island originally.

Reviews.Title: “Every year i have to stay in Casa Grande or we wont be happy going back home”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoUnitedfamily
Reviews.Content: one word to discribe as my 4-6 yr old would say..CASA GRANDE IS DELICIOUS MOM!! we go every year and a trip to the island is not a trip if we dont go visit Casa Grande.. let me put it this way keeping a 4yr boy and a 6yrs girl quiet in a retreat is tuff!!. but not in Casa Grande there is hicking or what they will call it ..exploring,is all an adventure for them,no game boys or tv..is all about imagination , the pool is great and the nite storys are wonderfull.even they relax. me and my husband just like to sit out on the beautifull deck at nite and look at the stars the look so clear and so close and we talk and meet each other again.after months of busy working weeks. WE LOVE IT! we cant wait to go back..and the staff..THEY ARE ALL WONDERFULL and the host..STEVE! always so attentive to all his guest. thanks for a wonderfull time see you guys next year.!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and gorgeous place with aprivacy issue”
Reviews.Author: eriv
Reviews.Content: I decided to book 2 nights in Casa Grande after some stressfull weeks, and once i got there like a miracle after a while i was totally calm and relaxed. This is an amazing and gorgeous place to relax your mind. The mountains, the wood cabins, the birds, the coquies, the pool is so pretty surrounded by the mountains, and there"s no noise at all. Food was ok, average, may be above average the chicken stew was amazing and very tasty. Whoever goes to this hotel has to have his mind set for what it is, its a retreat and the sorroundings are unbeatable, i read some people complaining about prices, and there are making no sense at all, the place is worth it, PERIOD. Ok here comes the bad, on my stay, YOGA WAS NOT AVAILABLE, MASSAGE WAS NOT AVAILABLE, WALK AROUND RIVERS EXCURSION WAS NOT AVAILABLE, i understand the owner Steve was out for vacation, but its advertised, and it should be provided. THE WORST PART... ,PRIVACY. The place is so quiet that you feel you have to whisper, which is a good thing cause it makes you relax even more, but at night you get to hear people having sex, snoring etc ,and not people from the room next door , people from the next building!!!, and there is no lunch, something should be provided, at least have a vendor machine to get some snacks or water bottles, if you are thirsty after 9 pm you will remain like that untill 8 pm in the morning, i didnt have the chance to meet Steve ( the owner) , but come on Steve!!! get some noise reduction material in the cabins, so people can enjoy some privacy ,i really beleive is possible, i was lucky i was the only one in my cabin i didnt have any guest next to my room, but i can imagine how bad would it be since i could hear the guest from the next cabin. Anyway its just a great and unique place to relax , you go there to read a book the hammocks and the atmosphere are so relaxing that after 10 minutes you end up sleeping in peace and calm. Will defently come back. STEVE FIX THE COMPLAINS, CHEERS.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking, but it is a "Green Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: evilkitty510
Reviews.Content: This was one of our favorite stops in Puerto Rico. We stayed here for two nights and absolutely loved it! The views from the hotel are of the most beautiful that we saw on the whole island. Banana and coffee plantations abound! As for the hotel: Pros - Beautiful view, nice pool, comfortable room, great for getting back to nature, decent restaurant - not many choices but quality food, great price! Cons - It is a spartan room with no AC or lush linens, but if you're okay with that, it's fine. Definitely not "camping" or something like that. It is really difficult to find and we got lost on our first trip there - we were fine after that though. You do pretty much have to eat dinner at the restaurant there unless you want to drive around Utuado at night - not recommended. Service was average - the owner is a retired lawyer from New York - which cracked us up because we're both law students and hope to be so lucky in retirement! In the end, I would definitely say the pros greatly outweighed the cons - amazing stop! Would not have done it any differently!

Reviews.Title: “Off the rocky-curvy path and worth it for the VIEW”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyKei
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for romantic seclusion this is it. We were one couple out of maybe five guests total and it was perfectly quiet. It was our second night of our honeymoon and we couldn't wait to jump into the pool and relax in our hammock. The sunrise in the morning was spectacular. This was an awesome way to start off our trip, thank you Casa Grande!

Reviews.Title: “get away...........”
Reviews.Author: ricky6939
Reviews.Content: this is really a get away a little hard to get to but well worth it ,good food ,clean,great people,we will be back next vacation.book for more then one nigth you wont regueret.have fun,do nothing just relax enjoy........................

Reviews.Title: “Everything we were looking for and much much more.”
Reviews.Author: T0mmyW
Reviews.Content: My daughter-in-law received her master's degree and as a gift, I offered her a trip to where-ever she wished to go. She chose Puerto Rico. A member of my Rotary Club takes students on geological and history tours in the Caribbean, so I asked him for his recommendation - he unhesitatingly recommended Casa Grande. It sounded just what I was looking for - my grown children are into hiking and outdoors, not the nite-club scene of San Juan. I made contact via internet and was amazed to find that the four of us could stay in adjoining rooms for a week at the same price I would pay for a single for two nights in most any metropolitan area. The owner corresponded and responded quickly each time I had a question. This is a retreat ... and that was what attracted me to the place. No phones ... no television ... not internet connection in the rooms - everything I needed to DIS-connect from the rest of the world. If you are looking for nightlife and want to touch-base with work and the rest of the world ... pick another place. This is a retreat. The location is fantastic - wondrous - words fail to convey the beauty of the place. Once off of Route 10, the road to Casa Grande is a two-lane road that twists and turns around the mountains. Caution in driving is a necessity. But the very road itself tells you that you are stepping away from the mainstream. We had no trouble locating the place, even though it was difficult to keep our eyes on the road ahead with the incredible views of mountains and valleys all around us. Casa Grande is a collection of cottages arranged up the mountainside. Each cottage contains four rooms - each with small porch and hammock. Ours was the cottage farthest up the mountain - one room on the mountain side and one room overlooking the valley. The mountain-side room was just that - you felt that you were in a tree-house on the mountain. Lush vegetation and jungle came within ten feet of the building. The valley side opening to an incredible view - this is a very narrow valley, so you are looking across to jungle that barely shows signs of human intervention. Sunrises and sunsets were breathtaking. The grounds are landscaped with trees, shrubs and flowers from throughout the tropical world - each labeled with the name and native location. We ate most of our meals at the restaurant. The food was delicious, presented beautifully. At first the wait staff seemed professionally distant, but the moment we warmed to them and engage in conversation, they warmed and responded. We laughed together, got recommendations of sites to visit, arranged for the bar tender to take us on a guided hike right from the resort and along a stream into the jungle where we swam in a pool beneath a wonderful water-fall. One disappointment was that, as an early riser, there was no coffee machine in the room, and coffee wasn't available at the restaurant until about 7. On the other hand, at the end of the day, the bar-tender graciously prepared a pitcher of their home-made san gria and allowed us to take it back to our rooms and the small patio area adjacent to our cottage entrance. The resort has a yoga center, and we started each day with a one-hour yoga class directed by the resort owner. He was gracious in accommodating those with little to no experience with yoga, but also challenged those with advanced skills. Woud I go back to Casa Grande? --- in a heartbeat. I fully intend to visit again as soon as I am able.

Reviews.Title: “MOUNTAIN RETREAT SAYS IT ALL!”
Reviews.Author: purdcm
Reviews.Content: This retreat was the highlight of our trip to Puerto Rico. Be sure to get there before it gets dark! Rooms were quaint and the hammock outside on the private deck was a relaxing treat. The landscape is breathtaking! Food was good, Sangria was great! Highly recommend this establishment to anyone visiting this beautiful island.

Reviews.Title: “Our Little Tree House”
Reviews.Author: tagonza
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Puerto Rico & according to my travel books, it was recommended to try out the Casa Grande Mountain Resort. We had a lovely experience while there. The drive to get there is simply beautiful, scary, but beautiful & the quiet solitude was exactly what we were looking for. The pool is simply beautiful & quite modern from what we expected. The room reminded me of summer camp, but it was cute. On each balcony is a hammock, but unfortunately they were quite dirty so we were unable to use it. The bed was comfy, but be prepared to have no air conditioning. The ceiling fan provided a nice breeze fortunately. If you're looking for something unique, I'd suggest checking this place out. The drive is an adventure in itself.

Reviews.Title: “If possible, book Room 4”
Reviews.Author: zrooster99
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and I's second stop on our trip to Puerto Rico... we were looking for a unique experience, and we definitely got it. We were very satisfied with our stay, and (I, at least) enjoyed the challenge of the drive to get there! Pros: Rooms - We had Room 4, which has one of the best views. The bed was uncomfortable, but the hammock on the porch was great! Hot showers, and good sized room. The lack of air conditioning wasn't a problem at all, and we stayed there in June! Food - We found our meals (dinner and breakfast) very delicious. I'd definitely recommend the meal plan. The service was good, although there was some confusion about the bill... it took the server quite awhile to bring us the bill, when we did get it, he didn't explain that we just had to sign it and it would be applied to our room. Grounds - Casa Grande is a truly fascinating place. The grounds is loaded with plants from all over the world. Beautiful and lush. Staff - very friendly. Cons: Bed - very uncomfortable beds... I really wish they'd upgrade the beds. I hate to say something this negative about this place, but our bed was simply painful. Other Notes: I think if you read the reviews on this site you'll realize that you aren't going to be staying at the Hilton... this place is an experience, not a luxury hotel, and it's an experience you'll be grateful for having if you go into it with that mindset!

Reviews.Title: “worthy of the drive”
Reviews.Author: querqus
Reviews.Content: The location is breath taking...if you are looking for a relaxing retreat this is the place for you. The rooms are sparsely furnished-reminiscent of a summer camp which was fine with the exception there is no good place to set anything in the bathroom or really in the bedroom either. I found the bed and pillows in need of replacing (not much life left in them) but we spent very little time in our room/cabin. The outdoor views were breathtaking and I would definitely stay there again, but probably bringing my own pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Best massage ever”
Reviews.Author: EmmyBVermont
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Casa Grande with our non-mobile 11 month old,a nd had a wonderful time. The drive was as expected, per others descriptions. We stopped in Utuado to stock up on a few baby supplies and snack items. They do not serve lunch at Casa Grande, and your options are quite limited if you are not touring the area. We were a bit disappointed with the hiking options: there is only a written description for a 2 hr hike that basically stuck to paved roads through the local village. It was pretty, but not a woodsy hike that we were hoping for. There was no mention of a guided hike with Steve, although I heard you could pay extra for that. Not interested. I did yoga one morning with Steve, which was great--the studio is fantastic and worth a peak. The food was good--nothing incredibly exciting, but enjoyable sitting out on the terrace., and a nice bar. As for traveling with a young child: the staff was very accomodating to us and our daughter, but she was also very well-behaved. She sat and played quietly during meals, was not yet crawling, so was content to just sit. She fell asleep quickly, and napped long and hard, and slept quietly all night, so I don't believe she disturbed the other guests at all. You can hear talking in the other rooms, and if she had been crying I would have been more worried. If she had been mobile I would have been much more nervous about her in our room, as the balconies are a big drop off to the ground. The pool was a little chilly for her, but she enjoyed it nonetheless. The highlight for me was a hot-stones massage with Helene. I have had many massages, and this was the best massage ever. She is very talented and experienced, and it was incredible. I convinced my husband to get one as well, and he loved it. All in all, very relaxing, lovely sweet little place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Eco Lodging”
Reviews.Author: Catherine_Gerry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this property last year and I forgot to write a review at that time. However, after reading several negative "nit-picking" reviews, I feel that I must respond. This property is somewhat remote...several hours drive from San Juan, so our expectations were realistic regarding the accommodations...actually they exceeded our expectations. Cottages, each composed of 4 separate units, are situated among beautiful, meticulously maintained gardens, surrounded by a rainforest for as far as you can see. The rooms were small, but adequate with minimal but tasteful furnishings. There was some noise in the early evening hours from the road, however, at night it was dead quiet. Of course, if the place was loaded with party animals, the experience would be quite different but lets be realistic. The food and service at the restaurant was what you would expect from a country lodge, OK, but not 5 star. We found the staff to be polite and accommodating. It is hard to believe that the complaints are justified. This is not a hotel...and to expect the same amenities as a hotel is naive to say the least. Book a room at El Convento, like we did after our stay at the Casa Grande. Then open up the discussion regarding value vs pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return to Casa Grande”
Reviews.Author: dcc524
Reviews.Content: Casa Grande is a small mountain inn situated in a lovely valley among the Utuado mountains (central Puerto Rico). The inn is quite small - only about 20 rooms spread among 5 cottages. The best part is, if you travel in the "cool" time of year (Nov - April) the fact there's no A/C is wonderful. We stayed over Easter weekend and the temp at night would easily go down to 55deg. When you're surrounded by mountains and dense vegetation - it's wonderful! The rooms: small, thin walls (speak low and mind the neighbors, and they'll return the favor), and a very basic bathroom. This Inn has been voted best "green" in numerous times, so the soap is eco-friendly and they don't provide shampoo. Likewise towels are thin, and no extra blankets provided. We live in San Juan, so I brought my nap blanket, which came very handy around 2am. The balcony - so (wonderfully) deceptive! This simple balcony and hammock will take hold of you and you will find yourself napping quite a lot. It's great! We had cabin # 8, which is the most private. It has a lovely giant fern outside the balcony next to the hammock. Awesome. Food was nice. Local cuisine. They don't serve lunch, so make sure to plan activities ahead of time. Morning yoga classes offered daily. When we were there a lovely young girl offered a number of spa treatments and massages, very nice when you're in such a relaxing location! We'll definitely return to Casa Grande.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: sdunlap
Reviews.Content: It seems that some others on this site have already eluded to this but I want to also confirm that you will be nickel and dimed at this location. My friend and I paid almost $14.00 just for coffee one morning during a lesser busy day of our stay. I have never stayed anywhere where they literally charge you for every cup of coffee, especially when the cups are miniature size, so of course you are going to drink more than one cup. The next day we noticed a buffet with all you can drink coffee. When we confronted the front desk upon checkout about the coffee issue, no attempt was made whatsoever to remove or reduce the charges for coffee on our total bill. Since I am in the travel industry I stay all of the world in different types of habitats but I have never been charged $14.00 for my coffee consumption, especially in a locale that grows coffee. While the only dinner that we had on-site had great service, I cannot say the same for the breakfast. Their was one particular female server who obviously did not want to be there for whatever reason and it showed. The only words she said to me during the entire week was an inquiry about my laptop. Of course, I kept my laptop with me during the entire week out of fear it would disappear. Then there's the phone service. There is absolutely no phone service available. Your cell phone won't work and they won't let you use the only landline available. They will however allow you to use an local cell phone which also seems to have the same lack of coverage but at a rate of 2.00 for the first minute and then an additional fee for each minute thereafter. Since this phone didn't have any better coverage than our own, we chose against it. Then there's the wireless internet that is limited. When we booked this room, we were told that each room had wireless service. Upon arrival, we found that the only true location for wireless was the restaurant, lobby and pool area. This was very inconvenient, especially since there was no phone coverage.
